Verónica manages a store selling products for the home. She lives with her family and has managed to set up her business by her own effort and with help from small loans. She, her husband, and their children tend to the business. She is open from 7:00am to 9:00pm.

She is requesting a loan to purchase products for her business. Her goal is to keep inventory strong by investing in snacks, personal hygiene products, detergents, cold cuts, and other items her customers demand.

This loan will help her improve her store. With this loan she aspires to achieve higher profitability so that she can continue improving her life as well as her family's.

loans.use: Compra de boquitas, productos de aseo personal, detergentes, embutidos.

loans.name: Marysol

texts.en: Marysol, who works hard to support her family, is married and has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 15 years now. She has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other materials for her business. In the future, Marysol would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхому 20 лет. Он молодой, красивый и умный человек. Он женат и живет вместе с женой и родителями. Он учится на 3 курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета по специальности юриста. В дальнейшем хочет стать известном юристом, но для этого он должен окончить университет. Если он не заплатит за учебу, то его исключат с университета. В этом году его родители не в состоянии оплатить за учебу и поэтому вы являетесь его единственной надеждой. Илхом запрашивает кредит на сумму 1700 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ilhom is 20 years old. He is a handsome and intelligent young man. He is married and lives with his wife and his parents. 

Ilhom is in his 3rd year of legal studies at Tajikistan State University. He wants to become a famous lawyer in the future, but in order to achieve this goal, he must first graduate. 

This year, Ilhom's parents are not in a position to cover the cost of his studies. If Ilhom cannot pay his tuition fees, the university will expel him. 

Ilhom's hopes are on Kiva lenders. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 1700 US dollars to pay his educational expenses. He is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To pay for study at the university

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga, 42-year-old mother of six children, all of whom go to school, is married to a businessman. She works as a merchant selling cereals in a small store in town.

In order to meet her customers’ demands and increase her clientele base, Kanga is requesting this loan to purchase more cereals for resale. She will consequently improve her income and thus her family's living standards. Kanga is determined to ensure her children get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: El señor Artemio, es una persona de 49 años de edad de estado civil soltero, pero vive en concubinato alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en su casa propia que se halla situado en la población de Tíraque, tiene 4 dependientes económicos a cargo, la actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, produce papa y haba en sus propias parcelas que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Sankayani Bajo del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 75 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Asimismo el cliente especialmente con la colaboración de sus hijos ofrece el servicio de parchado de llantas de automóviles en la misma población por el cual genera ingresos económicos adicionales.  Y finalmente el señor Artemio y su esposa manifiestan tener el deseo de poder incrementar su producción de papa y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la adquisición de semilla y abono de gallinaza, principal fertilizante orgánico que se utiliza en esta zona para mejorar el rendimiento del tubérculo y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos y atravez de ello mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Artemio, 49, is single but lives with someone.  He managed to complete elementary school.  He lives in his own house located in the town of Tíraque.  He has four economic dependents in his care.  His main activity is agriculture.  He grows potatoes and lima beans on his own parcels of land located in the community of Sankayani Bajo in the municipality of Tíraque about 75 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba.  

He also works repairing tires with help from his children in the same town and this generates extra income for him.  Artemio and his wife state that they want to be able to increase potato production and to do so need to request investment capital to buy seeds and bird guano which is the main organic fertilizer used in the zone to improve the tuber thus improving their income and by means of it improve the family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bird guano and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Candelaria

texts.es:
Maria, esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la inversión de la compra de sandalias en variedad de estilos y  para todas las edades, también comprara chancletas de baño en distintos estilos, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio y poder atraer mas clientes, diversificandose, ya que es un rubro mas que esta atendiendo en el mercado.
Su objetivo es aprovechar los fondos prestamos para hacer crecer el negocio, manifiesta que su experiencia con el préstamo anterior fue muy positiva, aumentando su buena demanda en los clientes y mejorando sus ingresos,lo invirtio en la elaboracion de bisuteria, su familia se mantiene estable.
texts.en:
Maria is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of sandals in different styles and for people of all ages. She will also buy flip-flops in different styles. This investment will help her improve availability in her business and she will be able to attract more customers and diversify, since this will add range to her business in the market. 

Her goal is to make the most of the loan funds to expand her business. She says she had a very positive experience with the previous loan: demand increased among her customers and her income improved. She invested in making costume jewelery and her family has stability.

loans.use: to purchase sandals and flip-flops.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 51 years old and married with 4 children.  

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 6 years.  She also earns an income from a machine shop.

Merlinda requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her general store.  Merlinda has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 59 years old and married with 6 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.   Milagros has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising goats, chickens, etc.

Milagros is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 5 years and also earns more income from food vending.  Trinidad is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing/fish vending business.

Trinidad has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy fishing net

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 67 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 9 years.  She sells a variety of items such as feeds, canned goods, soft drinks, soap, sugar, etc.

Victoria requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.   In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel, a 51-year-old married father of four, lives in the Philippines where he has earned his living for the past six years by operating a business providing transportation services to local community members. With a monthly income of about PHP 4,000, Joel has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to repair his vehicle for better service.

Having joined GDMPC this year, in the future Joel hopes to enable his children to complete their studies and increase the income he earns from his business.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Jovid

texts.ru: Джовиду 32 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена Наргиса домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми благами более 6 лет он занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Он продает свой товар на местном рынке, а также экспортирует в Российскую Федерацию. Он очень упорно работает, но его доход не позволяет ему оплатить за учебу сына в школе. Он запрашивает кредит для оплаты учебы сына. Джовид и его маленький сын ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Jovid is 32 years old. He is married and has 2 children. His wife Nargisa is a stay-at-home mom. 

In order to provide for all his family's needs, for the past six years Jovid has been buying and selling dried fruit. He sells his goods at the local market and also exports them to the Russian Federation. 

Jovid works very hard, but his income is not sufficient to cover the costs of his son's school fees. He is seeking a loan in order to pay for his son's schooling.

Jovid and his young son are grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To pay for son’s study at school

loans.name: Estela Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Estela de Profesión Auditora, mas de tres años que trabaja como Auditora, por ello solicita el presente crédito para poder adquirir una computadora, pues de esa manera podrá realizar con mas frecuencia su actividad Extra que desarrolla, pues es un ingreso que le ayuda para poder colaborar con la canasta familiar de su familia, la misma que se encuentra en la ciudad de Chuquisaca, ella se encarga de mandar dinero para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, la cliente es de familia muy humilde, solo ella les ayuda con los gastos que incurren tanto en su familia como personales, por ello se vino a nuestra ciudad para poder buscar un futuro mejor, se quedo a estudiar y ahora ya trabaja de manera eficiente en su puesto de trabajo, en el cual le tienen bastante confianza y además le brindan un apoyo moral ya que su familia esta lejos de la Sra. Estela.
texts.en: Estela is an auditor by profession.  She’s been working as an auditor for more than three years.  She’s asking for this loan to buy a computer because she’ll be able to do the extra work she does more frequently this way since it means additional income to help cover her family’s basic needs.  Her family is located in the city of Chuquisaca and she sends them money to help buy the basic staples they need.  Her family is very humble and she’s the only one that covers their and her own personal expenses.  This is why she moved to this city looking for a better future.  She stayed and studied and now works efficiently at her job where she’s trusted very much and where she gets moral support since her family is far away.

loans.use: to buy a computer to improve her work as an auditor.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a mini-bar business in the Philippines.  Amor has been in this business for 20 years.  She earns more income from a general store.

Amor is borrowing PHP 22500 through NWTF to purchase additional items for her mini-bar business.

Amor has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy items for her mini-bar

loans.name: Chongwa

texts.en:
Chongwa is 43 and has been married to Hadija for more than 15 years. They live in their own house in the town of Tiribe and have seven children who are all attending school. 

Chongwa is a very self-sacrificing person.  He says that he was a fisherman for a long time before starting a chicken selling business, a business which is now three years old. He buys local chickens from the rural areas, breeds them for few weeks before selling them for slaughter.  Thanks to his years of work and effort, nowadays he can offer his family a comfortable home with the necessary conveniences.

Chongwa is applying for this loan to buy more chicken for slaughter, as there is a lot of demand at this time of year. He is very happy about the opportunity he is receiving through Yehu and from Kiva.

loans.use: buy chickens to raise and sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en: Mercedita is now married with a child. She is 27 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba. Mercedita owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns 5,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Mercedita been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since this year. In the future, Mercedita's plan is to save her revenue in order to renovate their house.

loans.use: purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 59, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Zoilo and a mother to her children. She together with her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Nenita is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.es: La Sra. Margaret se dedica a la Preparación de Salteñas en su mismo domicilio, actividad que la viene desarrollando hace mas de tres años, por ello solicita un crédito para poder comprar una Maquina Sobadora para que de esa manera pueda atender mas rápido a sus clientes, es madre de cuatro niños a quienes junto con su esposo apoyan moral y económicamente, les brindan una educación buena para que en el futuro puedan defenderse y llegar a ser profesionales ya que su madre no pudo serlo por los problemas económicos que sus padres en ese entonces atravesaban, por ello su meta de la cliente es poder preparar mas salteñas para poder obtener un mayor ingreso y de esa manera poder colaborar a su esposo para que puedan seguir apoyando a sus hijos tanto en la Universidad como en el Colegio y además quiere brindar un mayor apoyo a sus padres ya que no tiene otra ayuda económica mas que la Sra. Margaret, pues así como ellos le apoyaron en los momentos mas difíciles ahora ellas es quien tiene que ayudarlos con lo que pueda, aseguro la cliente.
texts.en: Margaret works making ‘salteñas’ [meat turnovers] at home, an activity she’s been doing for more than three years which is why she’s asking for a loan to buy an electric kneader in order to work faster for her customers.  She’s the mother of four children who she and her husband support economically and morally; they provide them with a good education so that in future they will be able to fend for themselves and become professionals since she was unable to do so herself due to economic problems her parents had back then.  This is why her goal is to make more salteñas to earn higher income so that she can continue helping her husband support her children in university and in high school; she also wants to be able to continue supporting her parents since their only economic help comes from Margaret because as she states, just like they supported her in the most difficult times now it’s she who must help them any way she can.

loans.use: to buy a kneader.

loans.name: Jenny Maritza

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer trabajado y ha tenido la dicha que su familia siempre ha tenido panadería, fue ayer que ella aprendió a elaborar panes, pasteles, dulces etc. Jenny invirtió dinero para poner su propio negocio y desde entonces en la actualidad su horario de trabajo es de 5:00am hasta las 20:00pm y la apoya su familia. Para una mayor seguridad ha puesto rejas en su negocio.  

Jenny está casada, tiene 4 hijos estudian en escuela fiscal, su esposo también le ayuda en la panadería. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su negocio por eso quiere un  préstamo para  comprar ingredientes para elaborar pan y comprar un horno para aumentar su volumen de ventas. Unas de sus metas es mejorar el estado de su vivienda y que crezca su negocio
texts.en:
Jenny is a hardworking woman. She says that her family has always owned a bakery, which is how she learned to make bread, pastries, sweets, and other baked goods. Jenny invested money to start her own business where she currently works from 5:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. in order to support her family. In order to provide greater security, metal bars were installed over her business.

Jenny is married and has four children who attend a state school. Her husband also helps at the bakery. She has several aspirations for her business, so she wants a loan in order to buy ingredients for making bread. Jenny also wants to buy an oven to increase her sales. Among her goals are to improve her living conditions and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, and an oven.

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia, compuesta por su  esposa y dos hijos, se dedica a su negocio el cual es la venta de productos  de primera necesidad  y un molino; Los productos que comercializan son granos básicos, boquitas,  pastillas y el molino lo practica desde hace cinco años, su  horario es de lunes a domingo de seis de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, el aprendió este trabajo de su padre que se dedicaba al comercio. 
Ha solicitado un crédito que lo invertirá en el mantenimiento y reparación del molino en un cincuenta por ciento del crédito y el resto para la compra de mercadería para incrementar sus ventas por ejemplo boquitas, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, detergentes.
Este préstamo ayudara a que brinde un mejor servicio con el molino, sin dificultades, también surtirá la tienda; su aspiración es tener mas clientela ya que le permitirá tener mejores ingresos, ayudar a su familia y sobre todo a sus padres quienes ya son mayores de edad y les aporta una parte de sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José lives with his family which consists of his wife and two children.  He works in his business which is selling basic staples and providing milling services.  He sells snacks, basic grains and pills.  He’s run the mill for five years.  He works Monday through Sunday from 6 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.  He learned this job from his father who was a merchant.

He’s asked for a loan to invest in maintenance and repair of the mil; he will use 50% of it for this and the rest to buy merchandise to add to his stock.  He will buy snacks, cookies, soft-drinks, juices and detergent, for example.

This loan will help him provide better milling service problem-free and also to stock his store.  His hope is to have more customers in order to earn higher income to help his family and above all his parents who are elderly and he helps giving them part of his income.

loans.use: to buy snacks, cookies, soft-drinks, juice, detergent and to service his mill.

loans.name: Maria Orbelina

texts.es:
María, necesita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en su negocio, ha recibido un buen servicio que le permite decidirse por continuar trabajando, su compra será en arroz, frijoles, aceite, carne, pollo, condimentos y otros productos para la venta de comida.
Ella manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitio mejorar y fortalecer el negocio, con sus ganancias a podido ayudar a su familia, sus condiciones familiares se han mantenido estables hasta el momento.
texts.en: María needs a new loan to invest in her business.  She’s gotten good service so she’s decided to continue working.  She will buy rice, beans, oil, meat, chicken, condiments and other products needed for her food sales.  She states that the previous loan helped her improve and strengthen the business and was able to help her family with the profits.  To date, her family situation has remained stable.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, meat, chicken and condiments.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: El señor Federico es un cliente es una persona muy responsable, muy conocida en su sindicato como una persona dedicada a su familia y a su trabajo en el chaco, él se levanta a muy tempranas horas por las mañanas para empezar con su trabajo cotidiano, él se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con cultivos de 1 hectárea de yuca, de la cual saca 350 qq anuales, también cuenta con cultivos de 3 hectáreas de arroz de la cual saca 90 qq anuales, esta actividad le ayuda a sostener a su familia y llevar el sustento a su hogar, con anterioridad el cliente trabajaba con piña pero por factores climáticos perdió toda su plantación, es por eso que en la actualidad él solicita un crédito par a poder volver a plantar piña y así trabajar arduo para así poder mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de él y su familia. El cliente se entero las buenas condiciones de créditos que ofrece la institución por un comentario de uno de sus vecinos de su sindicato.
texts.en: Our client Federico is a very responsible person. He is known in his union for being dedicated to his family and to his work in the Chaco. He gets up very early every morning to start his daily work. He is a farmer and has an hectare of yuca that yields 350 quintals annually. He also has two plots of three hectares of rice that yield 90 quintals annually. This business allows him to support his family and provide for them. He used to grow pineapple, but because of weather conditions he lost his whole plantation. That is why he is currently requesting a loan, so that he can plant pineapple again and work hard to improve his income and, accordingly, his and his family's quality of life. He found out about the good terms our institution offers borrowers through a comment made by one of the neighbors of his union.

loans.use: to plant pineapple.

loans.name: Pary

texts.ru:
Пари 49 лет, замужем. Пари в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, на протяжении  20 лет занимается полеводством  и животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS ), потраченной на покупку одной нетели. Благодаря упорному труду Пари в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется 2 коровы с приплодом, 6 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 16,000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Пари обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Пари планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса посредством увеличения количества скота.
texts.en:
Pary is 49 years old and is married. 

As the main breadwinner of the family, for the last 20 years Pary has been raising livestock and growing crops. She started her business with only 3,000 Kyrgystan Som (KGS) which she used to buy one heifer. Thanks to Pary's hard work, today she has 2 cows with calves, 6 head of sheep and goats, and the monthly income from her farm is 16,000 KGS.

Pary approached Bai Tushum & Partners with a request for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS for the purpose of developing her business. She will use these funds to buy cattle to fatten and sell. Pary plans to re-invest the profit generated from this loan into her business by further increasing the number of cattle on her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha es casada y tiene cinco hijos, tres de los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando cuatro  habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como médico por más de seis horas al día y a veces cubre turnos toda la noche, ya que debe pagar los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia, también cuenta con los ingresos de su esposo ya que se dedica a la carpintería.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción de su vivienda ya que sus paredes se encuentran muy deterioradas y desea cambiar las calaminas del techo y hacer arreglar el tumbado ya que en tiempos de lluvia entra mucha agua.
El sueño de Mirtha, es construir más habitaciones y dar más comodidad a su familia de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Mirtha is married and has fice children, three of which are are school age.  They live in their own house occupying four rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Llojeta zone.

She currently gets income from working as a doctor for over six hours a day.  Sometimes she covers the all night shift because she needs to cover her family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.  The family also has income from her husband, a carpenter.

The loan that she needs is to repair her house.  The walls are very damaged, and she wants to change the plywood sheets on the roof.  She also wants to fix the ceilings because when it rains lots of water gets in.

Mirtha’s dream is to build more rooms and to make her family more comfortable.  This way she would improve their quality of life.

This is the second time she has requested a loan with IMPRO and the second with Kiva.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es casada y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando dos habitaciones pequeñas, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como profesora por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la refacción del bota agua de su vivienda ya que entra mucho agua más que todo en tiempo de lluvias y las paredes se están remojando.
El sueño de María, es mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la décima vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
María is married and has one school age child.  She lives in her parents’ house, occupying two small rooms.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Las Lomas zone.

She currently works as a teacher for over eight hours a day because she needs to cover her family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.

The loan that she needs is to repair the leak in her house.  A lot of water gets in, especially when it rains, and the walls are getting soaked.

María’s dream is to improve her income and to get a house in ‘anticrédico’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you].  She wants to do this in order to make her family more comfortable and to improve their quality of life.

This is the tenth loan she has requested from IMPRO and the second with Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the leak in her house.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Filomena, es soltera y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Calama de la ciudad de El Alto.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleada domestica por más de diez horas al día y fines de semana ya que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construcción como ladrillos, arena, cemento, estuco para la  construcción de una habitación más en su vivienda,  ya que desea darle más comodidad a su hijo y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Filomena es mejorar sus ingresos y hacer construir su casa.
Es la segunda vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Filomena is single, and has one son who is at school. They live in their own house, which just has one small room with brick walls and a dirt floor. The house is located in the Villa Calama area of the city of El Alto.

Filomena currently receives income, as she works as a domestic assistant for more than 10 hours each day, weekends included. With the little money she receives she has to pay for food, education and basic services for her family. She needs this loan to buy construction materials such as brick, cement, plaster and sand to build another room in her house. This will make things more comfortable for her son, and improve his quality of life.

Filomena’s dream is to improve her income and build her house. This is the second time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO, and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bricks, sand, cement and plaster to build another room in her house and give her son a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Ana Avigail

texts.es:
Ana, administra una tienda de productos domésticos,  vive con su familia, su esposo y tres hijos, este negocio esta bien ubicado en una cancha de futbol, comenzó por la necesidad que atravesaba su familia y falta de empleo, a logrado comprarse un vehiculo en el que se desplaza a vender frutas en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos, por algunas zonas cercanas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda, como embutidos, galletas, condimentos, dulces, aceite, arroz, cereal, huevos, este préstamo le ayudara a aumentar sus ingresos con las mejoras en las ventas, asi como su calidad de vida.
Su objetivo es mejorar su condición familiar con la superación del negocio, asi mismo mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana runs a grocery store.  She lives with her family, her husband and three children.  The business is well located near a soccer field.  She started out because of the need her family had and because of the lack of employment.  She’s managed to buy a vehicle she uses to go out selling fruit with her husband and children in nearby zones.

She’s requesting the loan to buy stock merchandise for the store like canned goods, cookies, condiments, candy, oil, rice, cereal and eggs.  This loan will help her increase her income with better sales as well as her quality of life.  Her objective is to improve her family condition through her business’ improvement; she will also make some improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cookies, condiments, candy, oil,, rice, cereal and eggs.

loans.name: Nadys Soleyda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nadys, vive con su esposa, tiene tres hijos, ella administra una pupuseria, este negocio tiene un horario de atención a los clientes de 7:00am a 10:00pm, su ventaja en las ventas es la buena ubicación con la que cuenta.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las pupusas, por ejemplo maíz, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, repollo, condimentos, gas, entre otros productos que son necesarios para elaborar sus ventas, este préstamo le permitirá mejorar su estilo de vida, mejorando su elaboración y las ventas.
El objetivo de Nadys es mejorar su condición de vida con la familia, prosperar en el negocio y que puedan solventar los inconvenientes que se le presenten en su hogar.
texts.en: Nadys lives with her husband and three children.  She runs a pupusa shop [filled, grilled corncakes].  The business is open to the public from 7am until 10pm. Her advantage is the good location she has.  She’s requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to make pupusas like for example, corn, rice, fried pork, string cheese, cabbage, condiments and gas, among others needed to make what she sells.  By improving production and sales, this loan will help her improve her lifestyle.  Nadys’ goal is to improve her family’s living condition, to prosper with the business and to be able to overcome any problem that arises at home.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, fried pork, string cheese, beans, cabbage, condiments and gas.

loans.name: Gelber Mauricio

texts.es:
Gelber, necesita continuar trabajando en el cultivo de hortalizas  es por ello que nos ha solicitado otro crédito el cual lo destinara  para comprar fertilizantes, semilla  de pepino  y ejotes.
Expresa que con el crédito anterior logro realizar una buena siembra, con una cosecha abundante y sana le permitio con las ganancias cancelar el crédito y cubrio los gastos del hogar, esta muy agradecido y desea continuar trabajando con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gelber needs to continue working growing vegetables, which is why he has requested another loan. The loan will be used to buy fertilizers and cucumber and green bean seeds. 

He told us that with the previous loan he was able to plant a good crop, which resulted in an abundant and healthy harvest. With the profits he was able to pay off his loan and cover the household expenses. He is very thankful and wants to keep working with his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and cucumber and green bean seeds to plant.

loans.name: Crispa

texts.en:
This is Crispa. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used for purchasing necessary equipment and materials for the salon. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy new equipment and materials needed for her salon. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Crispa dreams of growing her business and maintaining her good health in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of salon products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As the widowed parent of three children, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Angelita is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Maritza Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maritza, nos ha solicitado un crédito, para invertirlo en su negocio, en la compra de vitaminas y productos naturales para la limpieza corporal, entre otros productos que estan hechos a base natural.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior tuvo resultados que le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus inventarios, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado con relación al crédito anterior el motivo de solicitar otro préstamo es para mantenerse en mejora continua.
texts.en:
Maritza is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She plans to buy vitamins and products that cleanse the body. These products come from natural sources.

Maritza says that her previous loan resulted in greater sales and an increase in her inventory. Her financial conditions improved as a result of her previous loan. The reason why she is requesting another loan is that she wants these improvements to continue.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and natural body cleansing products.

loans.name: Blanca Neptalia

texts.es: Blanca tiene 46 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida junto a su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Ella estableció su propia fuente de ingresos, hace 4 años presta los servicios de corte de cabello, tintes, tratamientos, manicure y otros trabajos de belleza. Blanca ha mantenido este negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos lleva ocho ciclos con la institución. el préstamo actual es de 5,000 lempiras y lo utilizara en la compra de una silla de barbero porque la que tiene actualmente esta en mal estado y compra de tintes, champú, tratamientos, esmalte para mantener inventario de productos que usa en el salón. Su plan es mejorar el negocio y sus ingresos. Con las ganancias aporta al hogar y ayuda a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Blanca is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her husband and one of her children in the town of Tela, Atlántida.

Blanca established her own business four years ago as a source of income. She provides haircuts, coloring, treatments, manicures, and other beauty services. Blanca has been able to maintain her business by investing several loans from ODEF. She has participated in eight loan cycles.

Her current loan is in the amount of 5,000 HNL and will be used to buy a barber chair since the one she currently owns is in bad condition. She will also buy dyes, shampoo, treatments, and nail polishes in order to maintain the inventory of products she uses in her salon. Her plan is to improve her business and her income. With the earnings, she will be able to maintain her household and help her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, treatments, nail polishes, and a barber chair.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Francisca requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat. Francisca has been in this business for 30 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Matilde works hard to support her family. She has a dental clinic in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming rice. Matilde is borrowing 21,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her dental clinic.

Matilde has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the maintenance of her dental clinic

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 57 years old, married, and has three children. Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell. Myrna has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice. Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia is from Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She is 44 years old. Eugenia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Eugenia makes and sells snack foods.  She has been engaged in her business for 20 years and earns PHP 5,000 a month from these activities. Recently, Eugenia joined GDMPC. 

Eugenia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks for sale

loans.name: Usufono

texts.en:
Usufono is a 53-year-old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Usufono needs a loan to buy flour, oil, a new cooking oven, baking soda, sugar, and a large tin bowl. She plans to use her profits to help her family's situation and her kids' education.  Usufono has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: buy pancakes ingredients and cooking equipment

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife is married and has 3 children. She is 43 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba. 

Florife owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns PHP 4,000 each month.  Florife requested a loan of PHP 6,500 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Florife has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2011.  She hopes to expand and improve her plantation.

loans.use: purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 49,  a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo and is a mother to her children. She together with her husband manage their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Julieta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help continue operations of her business, Julieta is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julieta hopes to grow her business and dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mari

texts.en:
Mari  is a 32-year-old married woman with 4 children. She has a small plantation and grows bananas, taros and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years.

Mari has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, spades, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, and more baby taros to plant.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Mari hopes to help her business and her kids' education.

loans.use: buy farm supplies

loans.name: Marneth

texts.en:
This is Marneth.  She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Marneth would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marneth hopes to be able to expand soon, and dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy stocks for her general store

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
This is Maria Teresa.  She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities of fish and vegetables to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Maria Teresa would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to pay for fish, meat and vegetable supplies she needed in her business. The more fish, meat and vegetables displayed at her stall the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maria Teresa dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy fish, meat and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

Evangeline has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising chickens. Evangeline aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory to sell

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, trabaja con una tienda;  pero ha visto la necesidad de invertir para surtirla, es por ello que decidió solicitar un  crédito, lo necesita para abastecer su tienda comprando productos tales como: detergentes. cereales, carnes, bebidas refrescantes, boquitas, toallas desechables, papel higiénico.
Nos manifiesta que el crédito anterior tuvo efectos positivos ya que le permitió vender más, para el sustento de su familia, pagar las deudas y gastos, y la salud, la situación del hogar ha cambiado desde que solicito su primer crédito y poco a poco va saliendo con sus deudas y generando ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Graciela works in a small store. She has seen the need to restock her store, which is why she has requested a loan. She needs it to restock her store, to buy products like: soaps, cereals, meat, refreshing drinks, snacks, napkins and toilet paper.

She told us that the previous loan had positive results, because it allowed her to sell more, to help sustain the family by paying their debts and covering household and health expenses. The household situation has changed since she requested her first loan and little by little she is paying off her debts and generating income to cover the needs of the home.

loans.use: to buy soaps, cereals, meat and refreshing drinks.

loans.name: Tofioaiga

texts.en:
Tofioaiga is a 28-year-old woman who is married and has 3 children. She has a small business which is a cattle farm. She has been with this business for 3 years.

Tofioaiga needs a loan to buy a roll of barbed wire, nails, a wheelbarrow, a pair of gloves, and more calves. She will use her profits to help her business improve and pay for her kids' education.  Tofioaiga joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy farming supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, snack foods, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.  Elizabeth requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

In the future Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy stocks for her store

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina, se dedica a la  crianza de ganado, ha solicitado otro crédito para fortalecer el negocio y comprar cuatro terneros para cuidarlos  y luego revenderlos después de seis meses, el costo de cada ternero anda aproximadamente en un costo de $250.00 dólares c/u, espera con el prestamo poder cubrir la mayor parte de la inversion.
Manifiesta que el crédito anterior, resulto ser de mucha ayuda, por que compro un terreno donde actualmente vive y que todas las demás condiciones se mantienen.
texts.en:
Adelina raises cattle. She has requested another loan, this time to strengthen her business and buy four calves to care for and then re-sell after six months. The cost of each calf is approximately $250.00. She expects the loan to cover the greatest part of the investment. 

She notes that the previous loan was very helpful because she bought the land where she now lives and was able to get by with her other expenses.

loans.use: to purchase four calves.

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es:
Ana, esta decidida a solicitar otro préstamo por la necesidad de financiamiento, ya que necesita comprar insumos tales como: maíz, chicharrón, lociones y cosméticos; El crédito anterior repercutió en su negocio, en su estado de vida, le genero ganancias, le sirvio para el sustento, y el estudio  de sus hijos y de las ganancias pago el préstamo.
La vida le ha cambiado desde que se le dio el primer crédito, compro algunos electrodomésticos  incremento las ventas y le ha generado beneficios y ingresos para sacar adelante con el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to request another loan due to a need for funding because she needs to purchase supplies such as corn, pork, lotions and cosmetics. The previous loan had an impact on her business, her standard of living and generated profits. It helped with sustenance, her children’s education costs and she paid off that loan from the profits.

Life has changed since she was given the first loan. She bought some electrical appliances, increased her sales and has generated profits and earnings so that her children can get ahead in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase corn, pork, lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 42 years old and married with one child. For the past seven years, she has raised pigs in the Philippines. She has borrowed three previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

Irene is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, necesita seguir adelante con su trabajo agricola, pero su capacidad financiera no se lo permite, nos solicita otro crédito para seguir con su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos, necesita invertir en insumos  tales como: fertilizantes para cultivar granos básicos, compra de ocho sacos de abono y pagar el alquiler de dos manzanas de terreno donde cultivar.
Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior resulto muy útil obtuvo mayor resultados en la cosecha gracias a ese crédito hoy tiene mayor capacidad de ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis needs to continue with his farm work, but he does not have the financial capacity to do so. He is requesting another loan so that he can continue growing basic grains. Luis needs to invest in supplies such as fertilizers for cultivating basic grains, eight sacks of compost, and to pay the rent on two plots of farmland that he will use for cultivation.

Luis says that his previous loan was very useful. He achieved better results with his harvest thanks to that loan. Now he has greater income capacity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and to pay the rent on his farmland.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Ana Margarita de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, frijoles, arroz, pan, producto instantáneo, jabón, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en su vivienda y es muy conocido, tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además  del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Ana es una mujer enérgica, trabajadora, y con muchas metas por delante, esta dispuesta a esforzarse al máximo pues sabe que solo así podrá cumplir sus sueños y llegar al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar nuevas inversiones pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Ana Margarita tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita, 43 years old, lives with her life companion and son. She has a store where she sells basic supplies, beans, rice, bread, instant food products and soap, among other items. She has had the business for several years and this has given her valuable experience in sales that enables her to earn better profits.

The business is located in her house and is very well known. She has many customers since people prefer her because everything she sells is of the highest quality and at the most accessible prices. Her service is also unparalleled: she is at the disposal of her customers.

Ana is an energetic and hardworking woman who is eager to get ahead. She is ready to work to the fullest because she knows that is the only way to fulfill her dreams and achieve success. Like all good merchants she wants to grow her business and make new investments however she does not have enough capital. Therefore she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will enable her to purchase basic grains, bread, sweets, instant foods, drinks, soap, etc. Ana Margarita has a good credit history. She assures that she will be able to pay off the debt and is confident that she will be able to provide financial security to her household.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, such as bread, sweets, instant food products, drinks and soap.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is 37 years old and is married to a fisherman. The couple has seven school-going children, all of whom  live at home. For the past five years, Mbeyu has run a home-based business selling chickens and her children help her with her work. She has a kiosk in her compound and now has established customers.  

Mbeyu is requesting a loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She can get a better price for larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy chicken and chicken feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. For the past 25 years, she has run a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Josephine is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 28-year-old married woman supporting her husband, who works as a tailor. They have two sons. Fatmeh uses her artistic talent to make baskets from straw and plastic flowers. She has applied for this loan to buy more raw materials for making baskets. This will allow her to increase her productivity so that she can participate in upcoming handcrafts events.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making baskets

loans.name: Janvier Thomas

texts.fr: Monsieur Janvier Thomas est un homme marié qui vit au Sénégal.  Il est peintre de profession et capitalise une expérience de 5 ans dans ce domaine.  Néanmoins  parallèlement  il pratique le commerce et la vente de tissus pour renforcer ses revenus périodiques. Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC et a déjà remboursé 3 prêts antérieurs. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 prévu pour acheter des tissus a revendre. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux supporter les charges quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Janvier Thomas is a married man who lives in Senegal. He is a painter by profession, with five years of experience in his field. However, in order to earn a secondary source of reliable income, Janvier Thomas is also involved in the resale of fabric.

He is a member of one of the branches of UIMCEC and has already successfully repaid three prior loans. He is currently requesting a loan of 150,000 XOF so that he can purchase fabric for resale. The resulting increase in his income will help Janvier Thomas to better support his family and to pay for their daily living expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her shoe sales business.

loans.name: Sara Guadalupe

texts.es: Sara Guadalupe de veintiuno años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de tres años; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para damas y caballeros, tiene en variedad camisas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, entre otros,  tiene mas de catorce años de poseer el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas lo cual le permite obtener muy buenas ganancias, ella tiene su venta en un lugar muy estratégico muy concurrido de personas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precio accesible y con un servicio excelente; Sara es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor, todos los días se levanta con la disposición de luchar por un futuro mas  prospero pues sabe que solo así tendrá éxito; en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda  y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Sara Guadalupe tiene buenas referencias y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sara Guadalupe, age 21, lives with her life companion and her three year old son.  She buys and sells women’s and men’s clothes.  She has a variety of shirts, pants, dresses, blouses, and more.  She has had her business for over 14 years, and this has gifted her with a lot of sales experience.  This allows her to get very good income.

She sells in a very strategic place that is very busy.  She has obtained a lot of clientele.  They prefer her because she always has what they need, a quality product at a reasonable price.  She also provides excellent service.  

Sara is an enterprising woman who is devoted to her work.  She gets up every day with the inclination to strive for a more prosperous future.  She knows that it is only this way that she will be successful.

In the past weeks demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of this by making a new investment.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral that will allow her to buy clothes wholesale.

Sara Guadalupe has good references, and she is very responsible.  She affirms that she will be able to repay the loan and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur. For the past ten years, she has operated a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Judith earns additional income from farming sugarcane and operating a motorcycle transport business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans through NWTF.

Judith is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
This is Ricky. He previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase scrap materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household, and business expenditures. 
 
Ricky is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to buy scrap materials. He will incorporate his loan into his current revolving fund that he uses to buy materials. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs. Ricky looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. He hopes to grow his business in the coming years and dreams of having a good life for his family. Ricky faithfully meets up weekly with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy scrap and junk items such as plastics, cans, bottles, papers, and cartons to resell

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes's group is comprised of  hard-working women. Agnes is 22 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es: Elsa Beatriz de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la venta lo cual le permite siempre obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es mu transitado de personas y tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo esta elaborado con materia prima de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Elsa es una mujer emprendedora, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, todos los días se esfuerza al máximo en su labor pues sabe que solo así logrará el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la producción, necesita invertir por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. Elsa Beatriz tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Elsa Beatriz is 29 years old and lives with her life's companion and their children. She makes and sells tortillas. Elsa has dedicated various years to this business and it has given her much experience in sales, allowing her to always obtain the best earnings. The place where Elsa sells her tortillas is much transited and she has a lot of customers. People prefer her tortillas because she works with first-quality primary materials and offers accessible prices as well as good service.

Elsa is an active and enterprising woman with lots of desire to get ahead. Every day she pushes herself to work to the maximum; Elsa understands that only in this way will she succeed. In the last few weeks, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage by increasing production. Consequently, she had to request a loan from INTEGRAL that would permit her to buy corn at wholesale. Elsa has good payment references and is very responsible. She assures us that she can cover the debt and, at the same time, Elsa hopes to provide a full life for her family.

loans.use: buy corn at wholesale for her tortilla business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 52 years old and a single parent with one child. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past eight years, Anita has run a business cooking and selling food. She earns 6,000 PHP each month and joined GDMP in 2011.

Anita is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools to expand her business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of giving her child a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 27 years old and married to Marlon, a tricyle driver. Their income comes from providing transport services to people in their village. Her spouse has been doing this for five years now. They have a child who is still in elementary school. 

The couple hopes to earn income for their child's education, so Jenalyn is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy tires and gasoline for the motorcycle. This will help them provide service and earn income from it. Jenalyn also prays for safe travel for her husband and all their passengers too. The couple aims to have a stable income so they will achieve a fortunate life someday.

loans.use: to buy tires and gasoline for their motorcycle.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a 26-year-old married man living in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. To earn an income he sells bananas, which he has done for five years. He usually gets 5,000 per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Eric is able to buy more bananas to sell. He joined GDMPC just this year. Someday, he hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida. She previously accessed a 23,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of the tricycle. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain the daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of a good life for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repair of her tricycle and additional items for her tailoring business and store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase meat, sausages, dairy products, staple grains and drinks for her food stand.

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta Alicia de 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos pequeños hijos quienes gracias al esfuerzo de su madre cuentan con todo lo necesario para vivir. Berta posee una venta de verduras la cual está ubicado en el mercado municipal de su municipio, en donde ya cuenta con varios años de dedicarse a este oficio, logrando ser muy conocida en la zona lo que le ha dado la oportunidad de tener varios clientes fijos. Berta solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL  por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de verduras lo que le de la ventaja de comprar a precios un poco más bajos y de esta forma obtener más ganancias, lo cual es su objetivo principal.
texts.en:
Berta Alicia is 41 years old and is a single mother of two young children.  Thanks to her efforts, her children have everything they need.  She has a vegetable stall located in the municipal market in her area.  She has been doing this type of work for several years, and she has managed to build up a good reputation, which has enabled her to attract many regular customers.

She is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that she will be able to buy vegetables in larger quantities.  This gives her the advantage of buying at slightly lower prices so that she can make more profit, which is her main goal.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
¡Buenas tardes! Este es el Grupo Dio Es Amor y Mi Guia.

Shirley es la Presidenta del grupo y tiene 62 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores, una de ellas – Dóris - es también un miembro del grupo.

Shirley se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y de zapatos desde hace casi 15 años (antes era ama de casa). Los cosméticos los vende por catálogo, a sus vecinas y amigas. Los zapatos los compra en Lima y los vende en la selva, de donde es originaria, porque allá no hay tanta variedad de zapatos. A Shirley le encantan sus negocios porque le dan la oportunidad de conversar y viajar, lo que a ella le gusta mucho porque es una persona muy alegra.

Este préstamo Shirley lo va a usar para comprar cosméticos y zapatos. Shirley está muy orgullosa de pertenecer al Grupo Dio Es Amor y Mi Guia, ya que es un grupo muy puntual y responsable, donde todos los miembros pagan sus préstamos a tiempo y horas.

Hace unos meses Shirley fue asaltada, arrastrada unos metros de una moto-taxi, y hasta ahora tiene problemas en la cadera y lesiones en el brazo. Pero Shirley no quier pensar en los problemas del pasado y solo en el futuro que ha de venir. Su esperanza en este momento es ver su hija mayor feliz y realizada personalmente.

*En la parte superior izquierda en la fotografía pequeña aparece la Sra. Patricia.
texts.en:
Good afternoon!  This is the Dios Es Amor y Mi Guia  (God Is Love and My Guide) group.  Shirley is the President of the group.  She is 62 years old, married, and has two grown children.  One of them, Doris, is a member of the group.

Shirley has been selling cosmetics and shoes for almost 15 years (before that she was a housewife).  She sells the cosmetics by catalog to her neighbors and friends.  She buys the shoes in Lima, and she sells them in the forest that she is from.  She does this because they do not have much of a variety of shoes there.  She likes this very much because she is a very happy person.

Shirley is going to use this loan to buy cosmetics and shoes.  Shirley is very proud to belong to the Dios Es Amor y Mi Guia group because it is a very punctual and responsible group.  All of the members make their loan payments on time.

A few months ago Shirley was assaulted.  She was dragged for some meters by a ‘moto-taxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle]. She still has problems with her hip and injuries to her arm.  However, Shirley does not want to think about past problems.  She only wants to think about what is coming in the future.  At this time her hope is to see her daughter happier and personally fulfilled.

Shirley is the woman who talks in the video.  She is the second one from the right.  Shirley appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more products like shoes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: María Roselia

texts.es: María Roselia de 61 años de edad, es una señora muy dedicada al bienestar de su hogar, vive junto a un hijo quien es su único apoyo y con quien dividen los gastos del hogar. María posee una venta de sodas de diferentes sabores y hielo, lo que comercializa en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL  con el cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de sodas, las cuales se venden muy bien sobre todo los fines de semana. María tiene un enorme deseo de poder salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor junto a su hijo, por lo que espera mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Roselia, 61, is very dedicated to the well-being of her household.  She lives with a son who is her only support and with whom she shares the household expenses.  María has a business selling ice and various types of soda, which she sells in her home.  

She's requesting a loan from Integral with which she'll be able to buy wholesale soda, which sells very well, especially on the weekend.  María has a huge desire to be able to get ahead and have a better life with her son.  This is why she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy soda to supply her business

loans.name: Raúl Antonio

texts.es: Raúl Antonio 41 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador y responsable con su hogar, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Raúl posee un molino en su casa de habitación el cual alquila para que las personas puedan llegar a moler diferentes tipos de alimentos como maíz, verduras y otros más. Debido a que es el único molino que se encuentra en el sector posee mucho clientes razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar un molina más y repuestos para el que ya posee, de esta forma el espera atender a más clientes lo cual será de mucho beneficio para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Raúl Antonio, 41, is a very hardworking and family-oriented man, he lives with his wife and two young children. He owns a grinder in his home which he rents so that people can grinder different types of food such as corn, vegetables and more. 

As it is the only grinder in the area, Raúl has many customers which is why he is seeking a loan from Integral with which he will be able to buy one more grinder and spares for the one he already owns. In this manner, he hopes to serve more customers which would be of great benefit to him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a mill for business purposes.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Perú! El grupo “Los Girasoles” es  un grupo formado por 8 socios y está empezando ya el quinto ciclo. Un de los miembros de este grupo es Julia, que se dedica a la mecánica - o más específicamente a la muellería, siendo especializada en la venta, servicio de cambio y mantenimiento de los muelles (pieza o parte de un carro que va junto a la llanta).

Julia y su esposo tienen una larga experiencia en esta actividad, que empezaron hace 15 años porque el esposo de Julia tenía conocimientos en esa área. Los principales clientes de su negocio son los propietarios de autos, ómnibus, etc., y su principal característica es la rapidez en su trabajo.

Julia va a utilizar su préstamo en la compra de piezas para su negocio (muelles).

Julia tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 16, 10 y 8 años de edad. Su sueño es terminar de construir su propia casa y sacar a sus hijos profesionales. En la fotografía, Julia está ubicada en el centro, con una casaca verde y una chompa roja. Julia se alegra que personas de todo el mundo ayuden a micro-empresarios que necesitan apoyo como ella.

La fotografía adicional que se pegó es la de Yessica, que no pudo estar presente en el día en que se sacó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
