Son activité se porte principalement sur la culture du maïs et du haricot qui se déroule à Tchanié dans la région centrale où il est épaulé par huit employés. Babora est à son quatrième crédit à WAGES  qui est destiné à l’amélioration de la qualité de son travail. Comme perspectives d’avenir pour l’activité  et la famille, il espère respectivement augmenter sa superficie cultivable et construire une maison pour sa famille. Les autres membres du groupe exercent comme activité la culture du maïs et du haricot et souhaitent eux aussi augmenter leurs superficies cultivables.
texts.en: A solidarity group composed only of men, the SOKLIBI Association has Babora as its president. 49 years old, Babora is married to a housewife and is the father of two children, one of whom is still in school. Babora is a charcutier, or pork butcher, by profession, but has worked as a farmer since the 1990s. His business is mostly based in corn and bean farming which takes places in Tchanie in the central region, where he is helped by eight employees. Babora is on his fourth loan from WAGES, which is intended to improve the quality of his work. As future perspectives for his business and his family, he hopes respectively to increase his cultivatable area of farmland and to build a house for his family. The other members of the group work in corn and bean farming and they also want to increase their cultivatable farmland.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
El señor Leoncio es de la ciudad de Santaní, es casado, con hijos. El se dedica a la venta de carbón y a la agricultura, su señora se dedica a la cría de animales de corral. Ambos se ayudan mutuamente con la manutención de la casa, y de esa forma dan a sus hijos lo que necesitan para el día a dia.
Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto. Empezó a vender su producto en una carretilla y cuenta que su sueño de siempre era de tener una camioneta pero no pudo comprar, entonces compro para su cachape con dos caballo, ese es su medio de transporte en ese se moviliza por toda la zona para vender su producto, cuenta con clientela bien formada y con buenos ingresos mensuales. Solicita este crédito para compra de envase para carbón.
texts.en:
Leoncio is from the city of Santani, is married and has children.  He works selling charcoal and in agriculture.  His wife works raising farm animals.  They both help each other with the maintenance of the house and in this way they give their children what they need from day to day.  He is a hard working, responsible and very honest man.

He began to sell his product in a wheelbarrow and he says that his dream was always to have a pick-up truck, but he couldn't buy one, so he bought a cart with two horses.  This is his means of transportation and in it he gets around the whole area to sell his product.  He has a very dedicated clientele and a good monthly income.  He is requesting this loan to buy containers for charcoal.

loans.use: to buy containers for charcoal.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en: Subira, 38, lives with her partner Ali, in the town of Tiribe. They both work in the retail trade. Subira has a well-stocked store selling fruits and vegetables. She is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve her quality of life. Subira will use this loan to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, kale, etc. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the assistance that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, potatoes, kale, etc.

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en: Intisar, a 44-year-old mother of four, is a housewife who decided to help support the family to improve their living conditions and to be able to enroll all of her children in school and university in the future. Intisar started selling school supplies and stationery items such as pens, notebooks, etc. at home. She has applied for this loan to increase her inventory to make more profit in the “Back to School” season.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Dolores Amelio

texts.es: Dolores Amelio de veintiuno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida, su hijo y su hermano; el posee un pick up el cual utiliza para trasporte de pasajeros realiza, viajes  a diferentes alrededores de la zona donde reside, tiene experiencia en el manejo de personas es  por esto que sus clientes lo recomiendan, la localidad donde se ubica es muy concurrida de personas por lo que tiene trabajo todo el día, además de ser un hombre confiable al volante las personas lo prefieren por los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Dolores es un hombre entregado a su labor, responsable y lleno de metas a futuro, todos los días se levanta con la esperanza que con su esfuerzo dará un paso mas adelante para llegar al éxito, como todo hombre precavido quiere darle un mantenimiento preventivo al vehículo con el que trabaja pero no posee de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar repuestos si se necesita y el pago del mecánico. Dolores Amelio tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la confía que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Dolores Amelio is 21 and lives with his life partner, his son, and his brother. He owns a pick-up, which he uses to transport passengers. He makes trips to various places around the area where he lives. 

He has experience dealing with people and that is why his customers recommend him. The area where he is located is very busy with people, so he has work all day long. Besides being a reliable man behind the wheel, people prefer him because of his good prices and excellent service. 

Dolores is a man dedicated to his work: responsible and full of dreams for the future. Every day he gets up with the hope that with his effort he will take a forward step toward achieving success. 

As a prudent man, he wants to to do preventative maintenance on his work vehicle, but does not have capital. That is why he is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy parts if necessary, and to pay the mechanic. 

Dolores Amelio has good payment references and an impeccable moral character. He says he will be able to pay off the debt and is confident that the loan will provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: To pay for a mechanic and buy parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en: Fadwa is a 35-year-old single woman who supports one family member. She is from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy clothes to sell to her friends and neighbors. In the future, she would like to expand her business by opening a store, and she hopes to increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy products for use in her cheese-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy propane gas.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Nuevo Amanecer” ha trabajado con la Fundación Paraguaya desde febrero del 2010. Las integrantes del comité son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, manifiestan que tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo e individualmente.
Una de las miembros es la Sra. Felicita, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chipa (alimento típico paraguayo). Felicita cuenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que la chipa es muy consumida en todo momento del año.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de almidón, manteca, queso, huevos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos y de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The woman communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" (New Dawn) has worked with the Paraguayan Foundation since February 2010. The members of the committee are very close, responsible and united, they show that they are eager to work and get ahead, both as a group and individually. 

One of the members is Felicita, who is dedicated to the production and sale of "chipa" (cheese buns), which is a typical Paraguayan food. Pleased note that she has very good sales, since chipa is consumed at all times of the year.

She asks for a loan to purchase starch, butter, cheese, eggs and other ingredients to make her products and in this way help to her family.

loans.use: to purchase starch, butter, cheese, eggs and other ingredients

loans.name: Ybypyta Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Ybypyta Poty, se conformo con la iniciativa de una de las miembros. Actualmente se encuentran  en el segundo ciclo, con 10 integrantes.  El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras.
 Nilsa tiene una pequeña despensa con los insumos básicos, así surte a sus vecinos y a la vez también puede ayudar a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan. El sueño de Nilsa es poder tener una despensa más grande, ya que desea seguir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de panificados, verduras, lácteos, frutas, etc. Agradece por la oportunidad que ella y sus amigas reciben.
texts.en:
The “Ybypyta Poty" communal bank was formed through the initiative of one of the members. Currently they are in their second loan cycle, with ten members. 

The group was started, demonstrating unity and solidarity among the members. 

Nilsa has a small grocery store stocked with the basics. She supplies her neighbors, and at the same time can also help her family, giving them what they need. 

Nilsa's dream is to be able to have a larger grocery store, as she wishes to keep growing. 

She is applying for the loan to buy baked goods, vegetables, dairy products, fruit, etc. She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: To buy baked goods, vegetables, dairy products, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Susan is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2  years, she has been working hard to manage her small catering business, selling fast foods such as fried fish, chips and chicken. 

To help expand her business, Susan has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cooking oil and chicken for resale, and will help Susan to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Susan hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Susan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil and chicken for resale,

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta, 37 years old, is from Iraq. He is married and has four children. Atta is the only provider for the family. He owns a used clothing store, a business which he established in 2004. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.

Atta is requesting a loan of $2,000 to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions and his children with a good education.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in the town of Tiribe. She is single and has two school-aged children. For the past four months, Rehema has earned a living selling fish. She says that her business is doing very well because she has good customers who always come to her. In addition, she operates at a strategic point of the market where she attracts more customers.

Rehema is requesting this loan as she would like to add to her stock of fish and cooking oil. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving as it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to add to her stock of fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Erdenebat

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebat is 25 years old and lives with his mother, older brother, sister, and three younger brothers in a ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His mother is a librarian in a secondary school, and his sister is a teacher in a secondary school. His three younger brothers are college students. Mr. Erdenebat started his business in 2012 by buying a tennis table and a billiard table. His mother plans to sell office stationery, which is a marketable product, because soon she will be retired. His family's living conditions are not good, and his business income is not covering their needs. Mr. Erdenebat is a hardworking and honest person. He is asking for 2,500,000 MNT to purchase some inventory for his mother's office stationery business.

loans.use: To purchase some inventory for his mother's office stationery business

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El señor Osvaldo es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es dueño de un taller mecánico de motos y motocierras, cuenta que se dedica a esto hace 7 años, por lo que ya tiene muy buena clientela.
El es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que trabaja arduamente, y es justamente gracias a ese trabajo que esta creciendo con su negocio. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma ser un reconocido mecánico de la zona.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas que desea utilizar en su taller, para que de esa forma pueda dar un buen servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is from the city of Curuguaty. He is the owner of a repair shop for motorcycles and chainsaws. He says that he has been doing this work for seven years, so he already has a good clientele. 

He is a person with a strong desire to succeed, and that is why he works hard. It is precisely thanks to that work that his business is growing. His goal is to be able to continue working and that way be a well-known mechanic in the area, 

He is requesting the loan to purchase tools he wishes to use in his workshop, so that he can give good service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy items for making electrical tube parts

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: For the past 15 years, Veronica has operated a business selling gari (cassava flakes) in Bataya, near Cape Coast. She is married to a farmer and has 8 children. Veronica uses her income to support her husband with their family's general upkeep. She will use her loan to purchase bags of gari to sell. Veronica will use the new profit to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari (cassava flakes) to sell

loans.name: Dennis Komba's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to request a loan of 3,700,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, they will be empowered to meet certain financial constraints that they would not have been able to meet using their monthly salaries. 

Dennis is the leader of this group of teachers. The 37-year-old man is a native of Koidu city in Eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a housewife and the couple has 3 school-going children together. Dennis has requested this loan in order to buy household furniture like chairs, a bed, etc. to furnish his house.

loans.use: to buy household furniture like chairs, a bed, etc. to furnish his house.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu joined Yehu this year after being introduced by a friend. She has been an active member who attends center meetings.

Saumu's business is buying and selling ladies' and children's clothing which she gets from the city. She also sells ladies shoes.  The clothing that she buys is good quality and also cheap. Most of her customers work in well-known companies, which means that they have a steady income. Saumu says that, thanks to God, her business is doing very well and she would like to continue investing in it. 

She is requesting this loan to buy more clothing. She would like to stock her business so that she can offer her customers a good variety of clothing. She is grateful to Yehu for the confidence that they place in her with their loans.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Ly's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools and materials to increase her production of clothing.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia operates a grocery store in Batanya, which is near Cape Coast. She has been doing this for four years. The items in her grocery store are canned fish, canned tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc. She is married to a farmer and has two children. Lydia uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the profits, Lydia plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fresh, seasonal fruit

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a patient mother of four. She is an entrepreneur too. She raises hogs as a source of income. She has been in the business for almost 10 years now and is still aiming for an income increase. She is asking for a loan to provide enough sustenance for her hogs. She will buy hog feed and medicines for sustainability. This will ensure good nutrition and someday offer the hogs at a higher cost. She is in need of P10,000.

Though she only has a small business, she hopes to continue being a successful hog raiser in her village someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and medicine for her hogs' sustainability

loans.name: María Dinora

texts.es: María Dinora de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Carlos y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, el negocio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada de personas y ya tiene mucha clientela pues la prefieren porque todo es elaborado con material de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; María es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino a un futuro mas prospero,  sabe que de esa forma obtendrá el éxito; quiere aumentar la producción pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. María Dinora tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Dinora, age 43, lives with her life partner, Carlos, and their three children.  She sells tortillas.  She has had this business for several years, and this has gifted her with much sales experience that allows her to always get the best earnings.

The business is in a very busy area, and she now has a lot of clientele.  They prefer her because everything is made with first quality ingredients at reasonable prices.  She also provides good service.  María is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will help her find the best road to a more prosperous future.  She knows that she will be successful this way.  She wants to increase production, but she needs capital.

That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  The loan will allow her to buy wholesale corn.  María Dinora has good payment references. She is very responsible and assures that she’ll be able to repay the loan. At the same time, she has faith that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn.

loans.name: José Lino

texts.es: José Lino de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida Iris y su hijo Ernesto de cinco años; él se dedica a  la reparación y venta de llantas nuevas y usadas, desde hace nueve años, adicional a esto también vende gaseosas, paletas y recargas para teléfono pues le ayuda a complementar los gastos del hogar, sus años con el negocio le han regalado mucha experiencia que le permite realizar siempre, un trabajo de calidad y al mismo tiempo obtener las mejores ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela es muy conocido y recomendado por las personas del lugar pues saben que todo lo que comercia es confiable, de buena calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; José es un hombre activo, dedicado a su labor, le gusta entregarse por completo a lo que desea y uno de sus mas grandes sueños es alcanzar el éxito y pone todo su esfuerzo para lograrlo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar llantas por mayor, etc. José Lino tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza de ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
José Lino is 47 years old. He lives with Iris, his life partner, and their five-year-old son Ernesto. He has been repairing and selling new and used tires for nine years. In addition to this, he also sells soft drinks, popsicles, and cell phone top-ups, as it helps him offset the household expenses.

His years with the business have given him a great deal of experience that allows him to always do a quality job and at the same time obtain the best earnings. He has attracted a considerable clientele. 

He is very well known and recommended by the local people, as they know that everything he sells is reliable, of good quality and affordably priced. But above all, the service is excellent. 

Jose is an energetic man, devoted to his work. He likes to dedicate himself completely to what he wishes for, and one of his greatest dreams is to attain success. He puts all his effort into achieving it.  

In recent weeks, demand has increased, and he wants to take advantage of it to carry out a new investment; but he does not have working capital to support this. That is why he is applying to Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy tires at wholesale, etc. 

José Lino has good payment references. He is sure that he will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time hopes to offer his family a full life.

loans.use: To buy tires at wholesale.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Mr. Ganbold is 50 years old and lives with his wife and 4 daughters in a ger in Uvurhangai province. His wife works as a servant in a hotel. His eldest daughter is a college student and his other daughters attend the secondary school. Mr. Ganbold worked as an ironmaster in the town's landscaping office since 1989. When his organization closed down, he started his own ironware business. He produces stacks, eco-stoves, and tanks by using broken iron, scrap metals, and rejected iron materials. He sells his products in the local market. Now he requests a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy raw materials. He is a charitable and good natured man.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is a petty trader; she sells vegetables, such as tomatoes, onions, garden eggs, oil, and other food items. Diana has been in this business for 4 years now. She is married and has 4 children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Diana will use her loan to purchase food items and vegetables to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man from Jabal Al-Hussain, Amman, Jordan. He is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to pay for mobile credits to resell. He would like in the future to expand his project by opening a shop and he hopes to buy a home for his marriage.

Since Mohammad is under 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for mobile credits to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy required ingredients for a Punjabi food restaurant

loans.name: Koe Pyahu Group

texts.es:
Koe Pyahu es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está integrado por 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y con muchas ganas de superación. La Sra. Hilder es la presidenta del grupo. Se dedica a su trabajo de lavandera y es también empleada en una farmacia. Es muy activa, conversadora, trata a sus compañeras con mucho cariño y respeto, pero también es muy exigente con todas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de jabones, suavizantes para ropas, etc. Con lo que podrá seguir su trabajo de lavandera.
texts.en:
The Koe Pyahu group is from the city of Villa Elisa. It consists of 17 very hard-working women with great wills to achieve. Señora Hilder is the president of the group. She works as a laundress and is also an employee at a pharmacy. She is very active and talkative. She treats her fellow group members with much fondness and respect, but she is also very exacting with everyone.

She is applying for a loan to buy soap, fabric softeners, etc., with which she will be able to continue her work as a laundress.

loans.use: to buy soaps, fabric softeners, etc.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa is a petty trader; she sells maize. In front of her is the maize she sells; she is getting it ready for the market. Adwowa has been in this business for four years now. She is married with six children. Her husband works with the COCOBOD [Ghana Cocoa Board]. She uses her income to help her husband with the upkeep of their children. Adwowa will use her loan to purchase bags of maize to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Sixty-one-year-old Susan has run her own hairdressing salon for over 5 years. Her business allows her to support her family. Susan has many regular clients who are always satisfied with the results of her hairdressing salon service.  

Susan lives in Achajur village, Tavush area. Several years she worked as an economist, but then she decided to organize her own business. Susan has two daughters. One of them is married and lives separately from her mother, but her younger daughter lives with Susan and works at a clinic.

Susan is seeking a $2,000 loan to partly repair her salon and to buy new furniture for it. This will allow Susan to serve her clients in suitable conditions and to attract new clients.

loans.use: to partly repair her salon and to buy new furniture for it

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new embroidery frame.

loans.name: Ernesto Salvador

texts.es: Ernesto Salvador vive junto a su compañera de vida Diana y su hijo en casa de habitación propia; El posee una pequeña panadería  la cual es muy conocida en la localidad ya que vende los panes mas exquisitos y en variedad como quesadillas, tortas, pastelitos, pan francés entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia horneando pan, además le ha permitido obtener las mejores ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren y lo recomiendan porque saben que todo lo que vende lo elabora con materia prima de calidad y a buenos precios además de un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden del cliente; Ernesto es un hombre entregado a su labor, enérgico, muy motivado ya que ama su trabajo, tiene muchas metas que desea lograr y sabe que solo con todo su esfuerzo y valentía podrá alcanzar ese éxito que tanto desea, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y eso lo impulso a realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, dulce, bandejas etc. Ernesto Salvador tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura poder saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida como se la merecen.
texts.en:
Ernesto Salvador lives with his life partner Diana and his son in his own house. He owns a small bakery which is well known in the town because sells the most delicious breads and other varieties such as quesadillas [flour tortillas], cakes, pastries, and French bread, among others. 

He has had the business for several years and this gave him a lot of experience baking bread. Also, it allowed him to earn more money, since he has many customers. People prefer and recommend him because they know that everything he sells is made with quality ingredients and has good prices. Moreover, he offers an incomparable service, always ready to help customers. 

Ernesto is a man devoted to his work, energetic, and highly motivated because he loves his work. He has many goals he wants to accomplish, but he knows that he will reach the success he craves only with his effort and courage    

In the recent months, the demand increased and that drove him to make a new investment. However, he doesn't have enough capital, that's why he is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL, to buy flour, sugar, yeast, candies, trays, etc. 

Ernesto Salvador has good payment references, and he assures he will be able to pay off the debt. At the same time, he has faith that he will be able to give a better quality of life to his family, as they deserve.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, candies and trays

loans.name: Garavhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Garavhuu is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small house in Zavhan aimag [province]. Her husband is 44 years old and is in the transportation business. Her older daughter is a university student and the other two kids attend school. She operated a bakery business for one year in 2008 and started a flour and rice trade in 2009. Now she is running a grocery business from two rented stalls. 

Mrs. Garavhuu needs a 3,000,000 tugrik loan to pay for her daughter's tuition fees. Mrs. Garavhuu's goal is to run her business successfully and to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 57 years old and lives in a suburb of the capital city with her husband and 25-year-old son. The family earns their living through a small dairy farm. In particular, they own 3 milk cows whose milk is used for dairy products: cheese and yoghurt. Their dairy production is sold locally. Manana works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions of her family.

She has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan she plans to purchase an additional milk cow. This will allow Manana to receive more milk for her dairy and increase the sales, which provide her main income. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions and insure a better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew for sale in Batanya near Cape Coast. Adwowa is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She has been in this business for three years now. She uses her income to help her husband feed their children. Adwowa will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale. With the new profit, Adwowa plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El Señor Gustavo vive esta acompañado hace 4 años con la señora Sonia, viven en la ciudad de Carapeguá.
Don Gustavo nos cuenta que anteriormente trabajaba en Argentina como contratista y tras un esfuerzo de 5 años  pudo comprar una casa y abrir para su negocio en la ciudad de Carapeguá para poder radicarse nuevamente en el  Paraguay.
Ahora cuenta con una Bar-copetín hace aproximadamente 4 años y nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien y está muy feliz de volver a su país y a su ciudad. La solicitud del préstamo es para la compra de productos para su negocio, como ser  Agradece por la ayuda que recibe, pues le será muy útil
texts.en:
Señor Gustavo has been living with his partner, Señora Sonia, for four years. They live in the city of Carapeguá.

Don Gustavo tells us that he used to work in Argentina as a contractor, and after 5 years of effort he was able to buy a house and open his business in the city of Carapeguá so that he could settle again in Paraguay.

Now he has had a bar / fast-food counter for about 4 years, and he tells us that it is going very well for him and that he is very happy to return to his country and to his city. He is applying for the loan to buy products for his business, such as baked goods, beverages, seasonings, etc. He is grateful for the help that he is receiving, since it will be very useful to him.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, beverages, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Berta Luz

texts.es: Berta Luz de cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su hija, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, pan, leche, huevos, azúcar, jabones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le  permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida en la localidad la gente la recomienda porque su tienda es muy surtida siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y un servicio excelente; Berta  es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy motivada a salir adelante, le gusta luchar por sus sueños sabe que si se esfuerza al máximo lograra lo que se propone y tendrá mucho éxito en su vida. Como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Berta Luz tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Berta Luz, 58, lives with her daughter.  She has a store where she sells basic necessities, beans, rice, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, and soap, among other things.  She has had the business for several years, which has given her a lot of experience in sales, which always allows her to get the best earnings.

She's very well known in the town.  People recommend her because her store is well stocked.  She always has what people need at affordable prices and with quality products and excellent service.

Berta is very dedicated to her job, energetic, and very motivated to get ahead.  She likes to fight for her dreams.  She knows that if she makes the maximum effort she'll achieve what she sets out to and have a lot of success in life.

Like any good merchant she wants to grow the business and make another investment, so she's requesting a loan from Integral to buy staple items, candy, bread, instant food, drinks, soap, etc.

Berta Luz has a good payment record and impeccable morals.  She's certain she'll be able to pay back the debt and, at the same time, she's confident of bringing financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy staple items, candy, bread, instant food products, drinks, and soap

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa Elena de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y otros antojitos, con esto logra sostener los gastos de su casa, es muy conocida por toda la localidad donde vive pues es una persona trabajadora, responsable y muy amable con los vecinos, tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere por la calidad y los buenos precios saben que tiene el mejor servicio; Rosa se caracteriza por ser una madre admirable, para ella lo mas importante en su vida es la familia y un hogar donde se pueda compartir, en los últimos meses se decidió a mejorar su vivienda para mayor comodidad y seguridad de todos, pero para poder realizarlo necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar cerámica, cemento, pegamento y para pagar la mano de obra. Rosa Elena tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza de ganar para su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rosa Elena is 44 years old. She lives with her three children. She sells pupusas and other snacks, and with this she manages to support the household expenses. She is very well known in all the district where she lives, since she is a person who is hard-working, responsible, and very kind to her neighbors. She has many regular customers who prefer her for the quality of her products and her good prices, and they know that she has the best service. Rosa is known for being an admirable mother. For her, the most important thing in her life is her family and a home that can be shared. In recent months she decided to improve her home for better comfort and security for all, but in order to be able to do this, she needs supporting capital. For this reason she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy ceramic tiles, cement, and glue and pay for labor. Rosa Elena has good payment references and impeccable morals. She confirms that she will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time she hopes to gain a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tile, cement, and glue and pay for labor.

loans.name: Santos Obdulia

texts.es: Santos Obdulia de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y riguas en el mercado de la localidad donde reside, tiene varios años con su puesto y ya tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad del producto, por los buenos precios pero sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Santos es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino a un futuro mas prospero, trabaja con mucho esfuerzo porque sabe que solo así podrá conseguir el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, elote, chicharrón, frijoles, queso, verduras, etc. Santos Obdulia tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Santos Obdulia, fifty-three years old, lives with her life partner and with her daughter in their own house.  She works selling pupusas and riguas [Salvadoran food items] in the local market, where she has had a stall for several years and has a lot of sales experience.  She has attracted many customers because people prefer her products due to their quality, their good prices, and above all the excellent service.  Santos is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead, who is always looking for new opportunities that will open a route to a more prosperous future.  She works very hard because she knows that this is the only way to achieve the success she so desires.  In the past few weeks the demand has increased, so she wants to take advantage by making a new investment.  For this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to allow her to buy corn, corn on the cob, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, vegetables, etc.  Santos Obdulia has good payment references and gives her assurance that she will be able to repay the debt and is confident in being able to offer her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn, corn on the cob, pork cracklings, beans, cheese, vegetables.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a single parent  and has 5 children.  She is a food vendor.  She cooks yams  and fish stew for sale at Batanya near Cape Coast, which she has done for 4 years.  She uses her income to feed, clothe and to pay her children’s school fees.  Efua  will use her loan to purchase tubers of yam and fish to cook for sale. With the new profit, Efua plans to build a stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: buy yams and fish

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is from the village of Nasaguri, East Georgia. She is 41 years old and lives with her family -- husband, mother-in-law and three children (14, 17 and 18 years old).  Two of her children go to the local school and her elder daughter is a student. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Mzia’s husband works as a distributor and gets a monthly income. The family is involved in an animal husbandry business. In particular, they have 2 milk cows and 3 pigs. Mzia produces yogurt and cheese, which is sold locally. The family plans to fatten pigs and sell them during the winter season.

Mzia requested a loan to cultivate a plot of land and sow wheat. The family will do all relevant seasonal work to make a good harvest. The harvested wheat will be sold and this will increase the income for the family. With the increased income, Mzia will improve the living conditions for her family and insure a better future for them.

loans.use: cultivate a plot of land to grow wheat

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and 5 children at Batanya near Cape Coast. Araba is a fish vendor.  She buys fresh fish from the market and fries it for sale.  She had been in this business for a year now. She uses her income to support  the husband in paying their children’s school fees. 

Araba  wants to buy the fish in large quantity, so she need a loan from Kiva to do that.  With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de tortas mexicanas, es muy conocida en la localidad pues las tortas que comercia son exquisitas y tiene un sabor inigualable, tiene varios años con el pequeño negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite alcanzar las mejores ganancias, su puesto esta ubicado en una zona muy estratégica, muy transitada por personas es por eso que se hecho de mucha  clientela, la prefieren por la calidad, la higiene en las comida, por los buenos precios pero sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Rosa es una mujer dedicada a su labor, con muchos sueños que desea lograr, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le abran puertas al éxito y como es muy entregada cada día se acerca mas a su meta, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan, embutidos, carne, aderezos, bebidas, etc. Rosa María tiene buenas  referencias de pago es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que podrá dale a s familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 48 years old and lives with her life partner and her three children in the house they own. She is engaged in the manufacture and sale of Mexican sandwiches. She is very known in the town, because the sandwiches she sells are exquisite and have a unique taste. 

She has had the small business for several years and that gave her a lot of experience to achieve the best income possible. Her stall is located in a very strategic place for busy people, therefore she has a lot of customers. They prefer her for the quality, the hygiene of the food, the good prices and above all for the excellent service. 

Rosa is a woman dedicated to her work, with many dreams she wants to accomplish, always looking for alternatives to open doors to succeed. Because she is very devoted, each day she is closer to her goal. 

In the recent months, demand increased and she wants to take advantage of it by making a new investment. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy bread, sausages, meat, seasonings, beverages, etc. 

Rosa María has good payment references, she is very responsible and assures she will pay off the debt. At the same time, she is confident she will be able to give a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, sausages, meat, seasonings, and beverages

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 27-years-old and is a dedicated mother of five children. She is efficiently doing a business of selling milk and cattle rearing and has done this for many years. She has 3 buffaloes and 2 cows. She purchases small calves and sells them near the Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslim countries like Pakistan).  She earns a good profit from this business. 

According to Rukhsana, she faced many problems during her early married life. Her husband is a laborer. He was not able to cover the expenses for the family alone.  Rukhsana took the initiative to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf foundation 8 years ago. At this time, she is very much satisfied and requested for a repeat loan of RS 35000 to buy one more cow to increase her milk sales.  She intends to use the profits on her children’s well-being and education.

loans.use: buy a milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy embroidery supplies

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. Rani has been effectively doing a business of clothes trading for the last 4 years. Her collection is very famous in her town. She offers a variety of clothes in different colors to her customers and makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. He is not able to run his family circle alone. 

Rani is a loving mother of three daughters and two sons. She is supporting her husband in providing good food, health and education to all her family members. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of RS 40,000 to buy more clothes in various designs and different colors to resell.  Her customer base is diverse and varied. She is much in demand and highly appreciated among her community. She hopes to have more profits and hence to better support her family. Her dream is to provide her daughters with a good education.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Zebo

texts.en: Zebo is one of the smart members of her family who lives happily. She is 49 years old. She is a widow and is bringing up 2 children alone. Zebo tries to provide them with high quality living conditions. With this aim, 7 years ago she began her own business selling ‘kuraga’.  She buys a gardenful of apricot trees every year. She collects the apricots, dries them and sells them as ‘kuraga’ to the local people. The developing side of her business is connected to this harvest. This season she had a small harvest, that’s why she wants to buy additional ‘kuraga’ to make full her business assets and continue selling her goods.  Her income is small and she can’t do it by herself. She is asking for a loan of 9000 somonis to buy ‘kuraga’ for her  business. Each month she will make her payment on time. She will be happy if you support her.

loans.use: buy dried fruits to sell

loans.name: Mubariz

texts.en:
Mubariz is from Gardabani district. He is 57 years old and lives with his wife, sister and mother. His mother and wife are provided with a retirement pension. Mubariz works as an operator at the Ministry of Defence and gets a monthly salary. The family runs a small dairy business -- they have 2 milk cows whose milk is used for making cheese.  Part of cheese is used by the family and the rest is sold locally. Mubariz works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions of his family.

With the loan received from Credo, Mubariz will repair his cattle shed. He plans to expand his dairy farm through adding additional cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow him to implement this plan. Once his cattle shed is repaired, he will expand his animal husbandry business and the family’s income from dairy products sales will increase.  He will reinvest the additional earnings to expand his agricultural enterprise and make it more profitable.  Mubariz awaits your support.

loans.use: repair his cattle shed

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a 25-year-old conservative woman.  She asked her husband to take her place in the photo. She has three kids. 

Nour has a small handcraft business making baskets and trays using straws. She is thinking of making new items from straws such as frames.  For that purpose, she has applied for this youth loan in order to get more raw materials.

loans.use: buy straw materials

loans.name: Muslihiddin

texts.ru: Муслихиддин житель города Исфара. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Муслихиддин более шести лет занимается купле – продажей сухофруктов. Он берет кредит для покупки кураги и других видов сухофруктов с целью расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Muslihiddin is a resident of the city of Isfara. He is 30 years old and married with two children. His wife manages the household. For more than 6 years, Muslihiddin has worked selling dried fruit. 

Muslihiddin is getting a loan to purchase dried apricots and other kinds of dried fruit, with the goal of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase dried apricots and other kinds of dried fruit.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; ella se dedica a la compra y venta de billetes de lotería, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia en todos los alrededores de la zona es muy conocida y se ha hecho de mucha clientela las, personas la prefieren porque los billetes que comercia son muy confiables, a precio accesible y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden del cliente; María es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, muy luchadora, día a día busca alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, se esfuerza máximo en su trabajo y no piensa rendirse hasta lograrlo, como toda buena comerciante para expandir el negocio a otros lugares, quiere invertir de nuevo pero no posee de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar billetes de lotería en serie. María Teresa tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Teresa is forty-three years old and lives with her life partner in their own house.  She works selling lottery tickets.  She has done this work for several years and has gained much experience in the sales that allow her to obtain the highest earnings.  She operates in all of the surrounding area, is well known, and has acquired many customers because the tickets that she sells are very reliable, affordable, and come with unequalled service always in accordance with the customer's wishes.  Maria is very dedicated to her work, energetic, and hardworking.  Every day she is searching for alternatives that will open a route to success for her.  She works as hard as she can and will not stop until she succeeds.  Like all good business owners she wants to expand to other locations, and wants to invest more but does not have the capital. For this reason she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy a series of lottery tickets.  Maria Teresa has good payment references, and makes assurances that she will be able to repay the debt and at the same time has faith that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets to sell.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Ms Farhat is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 
She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.  She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La  Sra. Norma tiene 45 años es separada hace ya bastante años, tiene 3 hijos y vive en la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
La Sra. Norma cuenta con una casa de Producción de Eventos Sociales como cumpleaños, 15 años, casamientos, y otros acontecimientos, en su trabajo ella es muy emprendedora, y ama lo que hace, según cuenta había empezado sólo para cumpleaños infantiles con algunas decoraciones, pero más adelante fue tomando cursos de otras formas de decoraciones y de esa forma fue creciendo.
Hoy día está muy orgullosa de todo lo que ha logrado porque  a la hora de realizar sus trabajos ella lo hace con mucho amor y cuidado.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos de maquinas de coser, ya que utiliza estas maquinas para hacer sus decoraciones y es su principal herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en:
Norma is 45 years old.   She has been separated for a number of years, has 3 children, and lives in the city of Villa Elisa.

Norma has a business making and providing decorations for social events such as birthdays, girls’ fifteenth birthday celebrations, weddings, and other events.  She is very enterprising in her work and loves what she does.  Norma started out by providing some decorations for children’s birthdays, but later took classes about other types of decorations and that way was able to grow her business.  

Norma is very proud of everything that she has accomplished, and does her work with much love and care.  

She is asking for this loan so she can purchase sewing machine parts, since she uses a sewing machine to make her decorations and it is the main tool of her trade.

loans.use: to purchase sewing machine parts.

loans.name: Ansaf

texts.en: Ansaf is a 30-year-old mother for five. After her husband's retirement, he started working with his pick up car transporting stuff. This was their only source of income until one day she opened a mini market that helped in improving their living conditions. For that, she now has applied for this loan to add more goods to the store.

loans.use: to add more goods to the store.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana, es socia del banco comunal “Las Margaritas”. Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 69 años, viuda, ocho hijos, solo uno de sus hijos  vive  en su casa, pero ya no depende económicamente de ella.
Son 10 años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos  y se dedica a  confeccionar  y  a tejer toallitas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles comprara: 10 metro de tela para toalla, un paquete de hilo para tejer de varios colores, un rollo de blonda, medio ciento de rositas de tela.
Por su enfermedad tiene que estar más tiempo sentada y aprovecha para estar tejiendo las toallitas para luego darle los acabados correspondientes, agradecida con Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de seguir trabajando con los préstamos a pesar de su edad, porque en otras instituciones eso sería un obstáculo.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "Las Margaritas" communal bank in Coronel Portillo district, department of Ucayil. She is 69 years old, widowed, and has eight children. The only one of her children who still lives with her is not economically dependent on her.

It has been ten years since she started working with loans from Manuela Ramos. She is dedicated to making and knitting cloth napkins. With her new loan of 2,000.00 nuevos soles, she will buy: 10 meters of fabric for towels, a package of thread for weaving in various colors, a roll of lace, and 50 fabric roses.

Because of her health she has to spend a lot of time seated, so she takes advantage of this to knit her napkins and then give them finishing touches. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving her the opportunity to keep working, thanks to these loans, despite her age. With other institutions, her age would be an obstacle.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other supplies for making cloth napkins

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is pictured next to some gas canisters she has for sale.
Ilham is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to three sons and three daughters. Her husband and her elder daughter are workers who are getting low salaries, which are not enough to cover the family's needs.
For the past five years, Ilham has been selling gas canisters to customers, which has been a profitable undertaking especially since it is the only business in her area which sells gas canisters. She has many loyal customers and has a good reputation among them, but her project also needs more support from time to time to cover the costs.
Ilham is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more gas canisters for sale. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase more gas canisters for sale.

loans.name: Henry Edgardo

texts.es: Henry Edgardo de veinticinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, Él se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para dama y caballero, comercia de forma ambulante o desde su hogar, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la venta, es muy conocido en la localidad pues además de ser un buen vendedor es un hombre honesto, amigable y muy amable con las personas, se a hecho de mucha clientela siempre lo recomiendan porque tiene la mercadería de primera calidad, a precios bajos pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; Henry  es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante le gusta dedicarse a su trabajo y poner todo su corazón en el pues sabe que solo con esfuerzo y motivación lograra ese éxito que tanto desea, como todo buen comerciante ahora que aumento la demanda quiere aprovechar he invertir de nuevo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa interior por mayor. Henry Edgardo posee buenas referencias de pago, tiene la certeza que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía que podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Henry Edgardo, 25, lives with his wife and their son. He sells underwear for men and women, going door to door or selling it from his home. He has been doing this for some years and it has given him a lot of sales experience. He's very known in his town because aside from being a good salesman he's also honest, friendly and kind to people. He has a lot of customers who recommend him because he has the best quality products at good prices, but above all because of his excellent service. Henry is a determined man with a great desire to get ahead. He works hard and puts his heart into it because he knows that only through effort and motivation will he achieve the success he desires. 

Like all good merchants, now that demand has increased he wants to take advantage and invest again. For that reason he asks INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy undergarments in bulk. Henry Edgardo has good credit references and is certain he can pay back his debt, as well as being confident that he will be able to give his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy underwear in bulk.

loans.name: Ashkhen

texts.en:
Ashkhen has been running her own clothes trading business in Ijevan city for about 5 years. Her family has a stall where Ashkhen sells men’s, women’s and children’s clothes. She buys merchandise for her business weekly from Yerevan’s wholesale markets. Ashkhen has many regular customers as her stall’s assortment is very wide. Thanks to her business income Ashkhen is able to resolve a part of her family’s need. 
Ashkhen is 37 years old. She graduated from Yerevan State University’s biological department and she worked as a lecturer in college. Ashkhen is married and has 2 school-aged sons. Her husband works as a policeman and her retired mother-in-low helps Ashkhen with the business as much as possible.   
Ashkhen needs $ 3.000 loan to buy autumn season clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy autumn season clothes to resell

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Mr. Altangerel, 30 works as a tester of plumbing in private construction. He has been doing his job for 2 years. He lives with his family in the ger district, a slum district with Mongolian traditional yurts and houses in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been building a new family house with a grocery store. But some building works are missing due to a money shortage to buy building materials. Specifically he is planning to make the wall insulation for his new house with foam, brick and rock wool. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to cover the cost of building materials for wall insulation.

loans.use: To cover the cost of building materials for wall insulation.

loans.name: Rosa Estelita

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, es socia del banco comunal “Las Margaritas”. Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 67 años de edad, viuda, siete hijos.
Son 12 años que viene trabajando con este banco comunal y se dedica a  la costura, pero todo lo que son sabanas, almohadas, edredones, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija para hacer las labores de acabado.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprara: 20 metro de tela llana para sabana, 20 metro de tela estampada, 10 planchas de napa, 2 conos de hilo blanco, 2 conos de hilo, celeste, 2 conos de hilo rojo.
Es un negocio rentable, agradece a Manuela Ramos por hacer los talleres que es donde aprendió a confeccionar las sabanas , espera que sigan enseñando novedades, su trabajo lo realiza en su misma casa ya sus clientes saben dónde ir cuando necesitan sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Las Margaritas" communal bank in Coronel Portillo district, department of Ucayil. She is 67 years old, widowed, and has seven children.

She has been working with this communal bank for 12 years. She dedicates herself to sewing sheets, pillows, and quilts. She counts on her daughter to do the finishing work.

With her new loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, Rosa will buy: 20 meters of fabric for sheets, 20 meters of printed fabric, 10 sheets of batting, two spools of white thread, two spools of blue thread, and two spools of red thread.

Hers is a profitable business thanks to Manuela Ramos. She learned how to make sheets at one of the workshops Manuela Ramos runs, and hopes that they will continue teaching new things. She works in her own house, since her customers know where to find her when they need her products.

loans.use: to buy fabric and batting

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” se formo con la unión de 13 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, ellas son amigas y vecinas y han visto una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias con el comité de la fundación paraguaya.
Una de estas mujeres es Lina, ella tiene una modesta despensa bien surtida. Ella nos comenta que gracias a su trabajo y dedicación fue creciendo de a poco y de esa forma esta como está ahora. Su meta es tener una despensa más amplia y seguir ayudando así a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de embutidos, carnes, carbón, bebidas, etc, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y de esa forma estar cada vez mas cerca de su meta.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee was formed by the joining of 13 women in the city of Santaní. They are friends and neighbours that have seen a great opportunity for themselves and their families with the committee at the Paraguayan Foundation. 

One of these women is Lina who runs a modest but well-stocked store. She tells us that thanks to her work and dedication, her business is growing little by little which is how it has come to be as it is now. Her goal is to have a larger store and in this way to continue helping her family.

She is asking for this loan  in order to buy sausages, meats, coal, drinks, etc. With this she can continue to work and thus be ever closer to her goal.

loans.use: to buy sausage, meat, coal, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Ndue

texts.en:
Ndue is 49 years old and married. He has four children; the oldest is 29 and the youngest who attends school is 9. They all live in the northeastern part of the country, where the majority of residents are involved in raising goats, since the weather and terrain helps this kind of activity. Ndue is one of those who raise goats, selling milk and baby goats to the local market.

Ndue now wants to grow his business further and have his children do the same: get involved in the business. In addition to this, his plans include improving the family’s living conditions and educating the youngest child. This is why he is now requesting this loan to purchase 30 milk goats.

This loan will be a great help to Ndue, and his appreciation to lenders is just enormous.

loans.use: To purchase 30 milk goats.

loans.name: Maira Yesenia

texts.es: Maira Yesenia de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Marco y sus  tres hijos; ella se dedica a la venta de gallinas en el mercado de la localidad donde vive, es muy conocida, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, la prefieren porque lo que comercia es de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un excelente servicio; Maira es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y muy luchadora, día con día se esfuerza por ganarse un futuro prospero que la lleve al éxito, como todo buena comerciante quiere expandir el negocio comprando verduras porque es una venta muy rentable pero para invertir necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar gallinas y verduras por mayor. Maira tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maira Yesenia, 37, lives with her life partner Marco and her three children.  She works selling chickens in the market of the town where she lives.  She is very well known.  She has had the business for several years and this has given her a lot of experience, which allows her to get the best earnings.  She has gotten a lot of customers, who prefer her because what she sells is of top quality, at affordable prices, and with excellent service.

Maira is dedicated to her job, energetic, and a fighter.  Every day she makes the effort to get for herself a better future that will lead her to success.

As any good merchant, she wants to expand her business by buying vegetables, because they are a very profitable sale.  To invest, however, she needs capital.  For this reason she's asking Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy chickens and vegetables wholesale.

Maira has a good payment record and is very responsible.  She's certain that she'll be able to pay back the debt and, at the same time, confident that she'll be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Tserennadmid

texts.en:
Mrs. Tserennadmid, 26, is a hairdresser. She started her business just after she graduated high school in 2005. During the past years, she has gained a lot of experience and could become one of the most skillful hairdressers in Mongolia. 

She lives with her husband, her two sons and her mother in an old house in the ger district, an area of Mongolian traditional nomadic yurts and houses in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Her husband runs a taxi with his brother’s old car and earns not so much. Next year, she and her husband are planning to open a small grocery store in their backyard. It will be a very important step for her family, she said. 

Tserennadmid is planning to install the electric-heated floor in her new store. It will cut the use of a coal fired-stove further. The loan she is taking will be used to pay for the electric-heated floor at her store.

loans.use: to pay for an electric-heated floor at her store.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad appears in the photo working in his shop.
Mohammad is a 24-year-old single man. His father is employed but the low salary he gets isn't enough to cover the family's needs.
For the past three years, Mohammad has had a barber shop, which has been a profitable project because it is the only barber shop in his area. From time to time it needs more support to cover the costs.
Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing new barber shop equipment such as different types of scissors, hair dryers, hair brushes and a collection of hair creams. This will improve Mohammad's work quality, which will increase his income and offer him better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Emad

texts.en: Emad, 20 years old and single, is majoring in political science at the university. He is in his second year now. He applied for this loan in order to pay for his upcoming semester fees and hopes that after getting a bachelor of arts degree he would register to get a masters degree too.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Natela

texts.en:
Natela is from the Kharagauli district. She is 53 years old and lives with her husband, son and two grandsons. The children go to the local school. Natela’s husband and son work as artisans and earn a monthly income. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. They have a vineyard as well. Natela is involved in the dairy farm. She has two milk cows, two calves and two oxen. Natela produces dairy products and sells locally. She works hard, but still doesn’t have enough income for savings and to improve the living conditions of the family. 

Natela requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is old and damaged. She will purchase building materials and renovate her house. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Natela hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 30 years old. She is a very hard-working woman and wants above all to prosper and improve her quality of life. She lives in Tiribe, Kenya. Fatuma works every day at her small grocery shop which is located in one of the rooms in her residential house. She attributes the success of her business to her caring character and to the fact that she sells quality products at affordable prices. 

Fatuma is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, she will be able to add to her shop's stock by buying products such as flour, detergents, rice, and sugar. In this way, she can offer more variety and improve her income so she can keep working every day towards achieving her dream of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy products such as flour, detergents, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Aïdote Group

texts.fr: AÏDOTE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies appartenant à un même groupe de tontine et s’approvisionnant auprès du même fournisseur. La représentante du groupe, Christine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 38 ans et est mariée à un certain Etienne. Le couple a quatre enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Christine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Christine a n’a pas été à l’école. Il y a près de quinze ans que Christine mène comme activité la coiffure. Christine vend aussi, des mèches et de l’huile végétale par le système de distribution. Christine exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Christine s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Christine sollicite un cinquième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AÏDOTE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AÏDOTE group is made up of three members who are friends, belong to the same savings group, and buy from the same supplier.

The group's representative, Christine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is 38 years old, married to a man named Etienne, and the mother of four children who are all in their care.  Some of the children go to school.  Christine and Etienne live with their children and jointly take care of their various needs.  Christine never attended school.

Christine has been working as a hairdresser for the past fifteen years.  She also sells hair extensions and vegetable oil through the distribution system.  She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children.  She buys her supplies in her region. 

In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, Christine is requesting a fifth loan, along with the other members of the AÏDOTE group.  This loan will help them to better meet their customers' demand and to increase their profits.  

Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Rahmeh

texts.en: Rahmeh, aged 29, is a married woman and the mother of two children. Her husband is a water tank driver. She works as a teacher in a private school. After work, she sells decorations and artificial flowers from home. Rahmeh has applied for this youth loan to buy more art pieces and raw materials so she can start making some decorations herself.

loans.use: to buy more art pieces and raw materials

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is a 21-year-old single man. For the past five years, he has operated a barber shop. This has been a profitable project and is his only source of income, but his business needs more support to continue its work in an efficient way.

Zaki is requesting a 1,500 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new barber's shop kit to replace the old one which he uses. This will improve his work quality and attract more customers to visit his shop. This will increase his income and provide him with better living conditions. Zaki is photographed while he is working in his shop.

loans.use: To buy a new barber's kit for his shop

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: For 27 years now, Erlinda has been engaged in the business of rice farming. This is the common livelihood of the people living in the community of Trinidad, Bohol. This is the town where Erlinda and her family reside. She provides for her six children's needs through the income that she generates from farming. Her children are ages 11-27. She is asking for a loan to buy quality seedlings and fertilizer and pay for school fees. Her profit will be used for her children's education. In the future, she hopes to see her children be successful in life and for her to have a better farming business.

loans.use: to purchase quality seedlings and fertilizer and pay for school fees

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama est une jeune femme mariée.Elle est mère d'un enfant.Elle exerce dans le commerce depuis près de quatre ans.Elle dispose également d'une motocyclette qui fait du transport urbain dans sa localité.Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins ainsi qu'à ceux de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 400 000f pour acheter une nouvelle motocyclette.
texts.en:
Mariama is a young married woman and the mother of one child.  She has been involved in retail business for almost four years.

She also uses a motorcycle to provide urban transportation services in her town.  Thanks to this activity, she is able to meet her own needs as well as those of her family.

In order to boost her business, she is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Marta Noemí

texts.es: Marta Noemí de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo; ella posee una pastelería, elabora diferentes clases de pasteles al gusto del cliente, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la cocina, es muy conocida por las personas pues sus pasteles son los mas exquisitos, se ha hecho de mucha clientela la prefieren por que todo lo que comercia es elaborado con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles y con un excelente servicio; Marta es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante,  día con día se levanta con la esperanza de ganar un futuro mas prospero y trabaja muy duro para lograr ese éxito, desde hace algunos meses aumento la demanda de producto y quiere aprovechar para expandir el negocio, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a IINTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, leche, crema dulce, levadura, huevos, azúcar, etc. Marta Noemí tiene buenas referencias de pago, es responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le ofrecerá a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Marta Noemí is 33 years old and lives together with her life partner and her son. She has a dessert shop where she makes different kinds of desserts according to her customers' tastes. She has had this business for several years, and that has given her a great deal of cooking experience. She is well known by people, as her desserts are the most exquisite. She has earned many customers' business because everything she sells is made with top quality ingredients, and sold at accessible prices and with excellent service. 

Marta is an enterprising woman with a strong desire to get ahead. Day after day, she gets up with the hope of earning a more prosperous future, and she works very hard to achieve that success. For the last few months, product demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of that to expand the business. She needs to invest, but doesn't have sufficient capital. That is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy flour, milk, whipping cream, yeast, eggs, sugar, etc. 

Marta Noemí has good credit references and is responsible. She is sure that she will be able to pay off the debt while at the same time giving her family a better life.
