loans.use: to buy flour, milk, whipping cream, yeast, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a 44-year-old woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Together with her husband, she grows rice to support her family's needs. She works hard on her farm so she can earn a good profit. Letecia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings for her farm.

Letecia hopes to improve her business by expanding her land for cultivation so she can better provide for her family's needs. The income generated will pay her children's school fees. In the future, she hopes to see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and quality seedlings

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is from the south coast of Kenya. She is married and runs a vegetable stall selling fruits and vegetables. She has formed a customer base and brings in a good monthly income. Mejumaa is a very hard-working, responsible and honest lady. She tells how she began selling tomatoes and kale door to door. Her dream was always to have a well-stocked store with many customers. 

She is grateful to Yehu because thanks to their help she is fulfilling her dream. Mejumaa has approached Yehu and Kiva to request a loan which she wants to use to purchase fruits and vegetables. This will meet her customers' needs and increase her daily sales which will motivate her every day to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase assorted foodstuffs, chairs, tables and serving dishes

loans.name: Wahebah

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons, Wahebah prefers that her photo not be on the Internet so the above photo is of her husband.

Wahebah is a 21-year-old married female from Jabal Al Hussien in Amman, Jordan. She has one child and has requested a 500 JOD loan to pay for her home improvements. She wants to redecorate her home and buy some electrical equipment. She is looking forward to improving her family situation.

Since Wahebah is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache lives in the town of Tiribe. She is happily married and has two children from her marriage. She has a small area at the market where she sells fish, which she says she has been working in for two years. She says that it is doing very well because she has good clientele who like her fish due to their high quality.

Kache is requesting this loan as she would like to buy more fish, firewood, and cooking oil. She is grateful for the help; she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, firewood, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Nisreen prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Nisreen is a 29-year-old married woman who has two family members; they are from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy children's clothes to resell for her friends and neighbors in the same of area. She hopes to expand her project in the future. Since Nisreen is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es: Ana Hilda de sesenta y tres años de edad  vive junto a su hija en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, para damas, caballeros y niños,  posee en gran variedad vestidos, camisas, pantalones, trajes, entre otros, adicional a esto también vende medicina natural y otras cosas como almohadas y sabanas, con los años de trabajo en el negocio ha adquirido muy buena experiencia que le permitido obtener las mejores ganancias, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la primera calidad, buenos precios  y sobre todo un excelente servicio; Ana es una mujer dedicada a su labor, activa, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea trabajara con todo su esfuerzo porque sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito, aumento la demanda  y como toda buena comerciante quiere ampliar el negocio necesita invertir, pero no posee de capital por eso le solicita INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Ana Hilda tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Ana Hilda is 63 years old. She lives together with her daughter in her own house. She works selling clothing for women, men, and children. She has a large variety of dresses, shirts, pants, and suits, among others. In addition to clothing, she also sells natural remedies and other things like pillows and linens. 

Over the years of working in her business, she has gained very good experience that allows her to obtain better earnings. She has built a larget clientele, because people prefer her for the good quality, good prices, and above all, excellent service she offers. Ana is a woman who is active, dedicated to her work, and always fighting for what she wants. She will work with all her might because she knows that only through hard work will she reach success. 

Demand has increased and, like all good businesswomen, she wants to increase her business. She needs to invest, but she does't have the capital. That's why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy clothing at wholesale. 

Ana Hilda has good credit references; she is sure that she will be able to pay off the debt while at the same time giving her family a full life.

loans.use: to by clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan and her husband continue to run their food and household goods trading business. Susan says that recently they bought their own shop and this has allowed them to reduce the business’s expenses. Thanks to their business income, they have been able to support their family, paying for their children's education, organizing their children’s weddings and buying a car for their business. 

Susan used her first Kiva loan to diversify her shop’s product assortment. Now she needs a $3,000 loan to enlarge her new shop; thus, she will be able to display more merchandise and serve customers in appropriate conditions.

loans.use: to enlarge her new shop

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married mother who lives with her family (her spouse and their three children) in Tiribe, a town located in the coastal province, in the southern region of Kenya. Nuru has a tailor's shop where she makes clothes. She learned this from her mother. 

This will be Nuru's first loan and she has a lot of faith that her business will grow with this investment. She works 10 hours a day earning approximately 12,000 KES per month. She hopes to have a better sewing machine and to give jobs to people in her community. Her greatest goal is to see her children become responsible professionals. With this loan, Nuru will be able to purchase materials to make more clothes.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make more clothes.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a rice farmer from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has a baby who is only one year old. Marissa is asking for a loan to buy quality seedlings and grocery items like canned goods, sugar, seasoning, and toiletries for personal use. Her loan will be helpful so she can buy the needed inputs for her farming. In the future, she is hoping that she will be better prepared for the future of her child through her hard work and more business opportunities.

loans.use: buy quality seedlings and grocery items like canned goods, sugar, seasoning, and toiletries.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en: Felistus is a 27-year-old married woman. She has a child who is four years old. She describes herself to be an honest and faithful woman. She operates a general store where she sells items such as clothes, handbags, shoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located near a bus station and her primary customers are passengers and passersby. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power from customers and high prices of clothes, shoes, and handbags. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes, bags, and shoes. Her business goal is to run another general store within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and handbags.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 22 years old from Gaza. He owns a clothing shop for selling women clothes. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy display models for the shop. He hopes that this will increase his customers and improve his income and thus approach his dream of getting married and having a lovely family.

loans.use: to buy display models for the clothing shop.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is 28 years old from Tulkarem. He owns a green house since 2001 in which he plants tomatoes and cucumbers. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more seeds and plant more cucumbers and tomatoes. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and help him build a better future.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and plant more cucumbers and tomatoes.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en: Kholoud is a 42-year-old married woman; she has two sons and a daughter. She is a hardworking creative woman. She has a workshop for making mosaic pieces. Kholoud started from scratch and built up her business until she opened a workshop and a store for selling what she makes. She is also employing young people to help their families and fill their time doing something useful. Now, she has applied for this loan to buy new carving tools for the workshop to employ more people.

loans.use: to buy new carving tools for her art work.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 30 years old and lives in Gaza.

He owns a shop in which he buys chicken and sells it ready to be cooked.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy a machine for plucking chicken feathers.

He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and increase the number of customers.

loans.use: to buy a machine for plucking chicken feathers

loans.name: Dina

texts.en: Dina, 30 years old, is a married woman with four daughters. She is helping her husband to improve their living conditions by having a small clothing sales business at home.  Now she has applied for this loan to buy a new collection of clothes to increase her profits in hopes that one day she can open her own clothing store.

loans.use: to get a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is 23 years old and lives in Gaza.

He finished his Bachelor's Degree in education and opened a grocery store in 2009.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy goods like drinks, yogurt, and different food provisions and varieties for his store.

He hopes that this loan will help him improve his income and approach his dream of owning a bigger store and being employed with his university degree.

loans.use: to buy goods like drinks, yogurt,and other items for his store.

loans.name: Telma Aracely

texts.es: Telma Aracely de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de la localidad donde vive,posee tomates, cebollas, papas, chiele, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues es muy amable y servicial, las personas la recomiendan porque tiene la mercadería mas fresca, de primera calidad y sobre todo a precios accesibles; Telma es una mujer enérgica, trabajadora, y con muchos sueños que desea alcanzar, todos los días se levanta con la confianza que con el tiempo lograra ganarse un futuro mas prospero, se esforzara al máximo porque sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tomates, cebolla, chiles, papas, plátanos, naranjas, etc. Telma Aracely tiene buenas referencias de pago, es responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le ofrecerá seguridad económica al hogar.
texts.en:
Telma Aracely is sixty years old. She lives together with her life partner. She works selling fruits and vegetables in the market in the town where she lives. She has tomatoes, onions, potatoes, chilis, and more. She has had this business for several years and she has gained a lot of experience in sales. She has built a large clientele as she is very pleasant and helpful. People recommend her because she has the freshest produce with top quality and above all low prices. 

Telma is an energetic, hardworking woman with many dreams she hopes to achieve. Every day, she gets up trusting that with time, she will manage to earn herself a more prosperous future. She will put in maximum effort because she knows that it's the only way she will reach success. 

In recent weeks, demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of that to make a new investment, but she doesn't have sufficient capital. That's why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy tomatoes, onions, chilis, potatoes, plantains, oranges, etc. 

Telma Aracely has good credit references and is responsible. She is sure that she will be able to pay off the debt and has faith that she will be able to offer economic security to her household.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, chilis, potatoes, plantains, and oranges.

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola, aged 19, is a single woman who is majoring in English literature and languages. She is still in her freshman year. Ola has applied for this loan in order to pay her college registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her college registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Tamara prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus, the above photo is of her husband. Tamara is a 19-year-old married woman who has one family member. They are from Bani Kenanah Irbid, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements; she would like to buy a new furniture and to do maintenance of the home. In the future, she wants to improve her living standard. Since Tamara is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en: Primitiva is 59 years old. She is married with six adult children. Primitiva works hard in her farm with her husband who is also a farmer. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. A healthy and lush rice field is attributed to the availability of fertilizer. She will invest her profit in her family's daily consumption and reinvest in the same business. In the future, she hopes to continue farming in a better, bigger land for better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Mashael

texts.en: Mashael is a 39-year-old married woman; she has five kids. She is helping her husband to improve their living conditions by selling women's clothes at home. She has applied for this loan to display a new collection to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: to display a new collection of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali, 21 years old, is a single young man who works in a sweets shop to support himself and help his family. He is also a student at one of the Jordanian colleges. He has applied for this loan in order to pay for his upcoming semester fees since he faces a shortage of funds to pay for the fees for this semester.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Wajdi

texts.en: Wajdi, 26 years old, is a single guy who works and studies at the same time. Wajdi works in a wedding hall and he is a student in a private university majoring in Accounting in his third year. He has applied for this loan to pay for his registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his registration and semester fees.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 57 years old. She is married and has three adult children. She and her husband work on a farm to earn an income. Together, they grow rice to support their family's basic needs. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and eyeglasses. The loan will be such a big help for her business so that she can focus on just looking after her farm without having to worry about the source of additional capital for the inputs. In the future, she would like to expand her business to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, quality seedlings and eyeglasses

loans.name: Mirna Yoany

texts.es:
Mirna, esta solicitando un préstamo porque quiere invertir en la venta de tortillas ya que debe comprarse materiales como maíz, leña, gas, esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar la disponibilidad y obtener mejores precios, así mantendrá trabajo y un mejor servicio.
Con el préstamo anterior ha mejorado su situación en el hogar y el negocio, ya que se le facilito la elaboración de las tortillas con los materiales, sus ingresos han mejorado y su clientela aumento, gracias al préstamo con  Kiva su condición esta mejorando.
texts.en:
Mirna is requesting a loan because she wants to invest in the sale of tortillas. She needs to buy supplies such as corn, firewood, and gas. This investment will help improve her available inventory and enable her to obtain better prices so that she can keep working and provide better service.

Mirna's previous loan improved her situation at home and with her business. She was able to produce tortillas with the supplies she purchased, which led to more income and an increase in customers. Thanks to the Kiva loan, her condition has improved.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and gas.

loans.name: Tinatin

texts.en:
Tinatin is from Zestaponi district, West Georgia. She is 58 years old and lives with her husband, Zurab, who receives a retirement pension. The family runs an animal husbandry business - they have six milking cows, two calves and five pigs. Tinatin produces dairy products and sells them at the local open market. She also has a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. The family owns a vineyard and picks the grapes in the late summer. Tinatin and Zurab work hard to make some savings and improve their living conditions.
 
Tinatin has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase milking cows. This will allow her to receive more milk from her dairy and increase the sales which provide her main income. This will give her an opportunity to reinvest in her agricultural business and improve her family's living conditions. Tinatin awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows

loans.name: Philip   Mutua

texts.en: Philip is 39 years old and married with four children who are in school. He plants flowers and sells them to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years and has employed two people. Besides this, he does livestock farming to generate more income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped him to grow his business. He dreams of becoming a large-scale farmer in the future. Philip is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES to buy a water tank and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and fertilizers

loans.name: María Arminda

texts.es: María Arminda de cincuenta y seis años de edad vive junto  a su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de mariscos y pollo en libras desde hace mas de diez años, posee la crianza de pollos porque así  obtiene mas ganancia, los años de trabajo le han regalado valiosa experiencia en las ventas que le permite mejorar cada vez mas en su trabajo, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque toda la mercadería que comercia es confiable, de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio; María es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor, capaz de alcanzar todas las metas que se proponga, siempre esta buscando oportunidades que le abran paso al éxito y no piensa rendirse hasta lograr su propósito, como toda buena comerciante quiere expandir el negocio, pero para ello necesita de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar mariscos, pollos, concentrado y maíz. María Arminda tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: María Arminda, 56, lives with her life partner. For over ten years, she has dedicated herself to selling shellfish and chicken by the pound. She raises her own chickens because this way she earns more profits. Her years of working have given her great sales experience that allows her to continuously improve her work. She has earned many customers, as people prefer her because all of the merchandise she sells is trustworthy and of top quality, at accessible prices, and above all, because of her excellent service. María is an active woman, dedicated to her work and capable of achieving all of the goals she proposes. She is always looking for opportunities that could open the path to success, and she does not think about giving up until she has reached her goal. Like any good merchant, she wants to expand her business, but in order to do so she needs capital support. That is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. This loan will allow her to buy shellfish, chickens, concentrated chicken feed, and corn. María Arminda has good credit references and impeccable morals, so she is certain she will be able to pay off her debt and at the same time, she has hope that she will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy shellfish, chickens, concentrated chicken feed, and corn

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: La socia es la señora María Luisa, la socia continua con su actividad comercial de comercio de artesanía, principalmente de tejidos como chompas, bufandas, guantes, gorros etc. y los comercializa en su stand de uno de los mercados artesanales más importantes de la ciudad. María Luisa se ha mantenido trabajando en esta actividad comercial, la cual le ha permitido salir adelante y poder educar a sus hijos, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como chompas, ponchos y bufandas, para poder capitalizar su comercio, por ello la socia está muy agradecida con KIVA, por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo, la socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. María Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The borrower is María Luisa. She is continuing with her business selling crafts: mainly knitted items such as sweaters, scarves, gloves, hats, etc. She sells them at her stand in one of the city's most important craft markets. 

María Luisa has supported herself by working in this business, which has allowed her to move forward in life and to be able to raise her children. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy merchandise such as sweaters, ponchos and scarves, in order to capitalize her business. For that reason she is very grateful to Kiva for helping her progress in her work. She promises to make her installment payments on time. 

María Luisa belongs to the “Kukuli" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy clothing such as sweaters, scarves, gloves and hats.

loans.name: Abdulsalam

texts.en: Abdulsalam, aged 33, is single and lives with his family. He has a small shop where he sells different types of birds, bird cages and food. He wants to expand his business by buying more types of birds to increase his profits; therefore, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more types of birds

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia, aged 49, is from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her eldest is 27 and the youngest is 15. She is determined to see her children succeed and she works hard so she can send them to school. Ignacia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and quality seedlings which are necessary for her farming success. In the future, she hopes to see her business grow and to earn a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and quality seedlings

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour, aged 29, is married to a man serving in the military. She has started a small home business selling accessories. Now, she wants to expand it; therefore, she has applied for this loan so she can buy a new collection of accessories to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of accessories

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en: Mwanaisha is married and has six children who attend school. Thanks to her efforts, she is able to educate her children and purchase all the household necessities. She has proven to be responsible and honest in her commitments. Mwanaisha operates a food-selling business, selling from her home. She started the business with help from her husband who is a primary school teacher. She is requesting the loan to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and beans. She always wants to see her customers satisfied. Mwanaisha's dream is to own a cafe.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and beans.

loans.name: Rawaa

texts.en: Rawaa, aged 19, is a single woman who is majoring in Nursery (Child Care) at one of the Jordanian colleges. She has applied for this loan to pay her college registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her college registration and semester fees

loans.name: Jinny Mae

texts.en:
Jinny Mae is a 21-year-old woman from the community of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and relies on her vulcanizing shop business to support her two children aged one and three. Jinny Mae is focusing on her business so she can make it more profitable. 

Jinny Mae is asking for a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy a welding machine, compressor and welding rods. This will help her to provide a better service to her customers. The income generated will provide her children with a healthy diet. In the future, she would like to expand her services and her business location so she can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine, compressor and welding rods

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 40-year-old food stall owner in Bombolulu, Mombasa. He is married to Veronica and they have three children aged 12, nine and seven. He ventured into this business seven years ago and it's doing well.

This is Joseph's first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase assorted foodstuffs and utensils for use in his food stall business. 

He will use the anticipated profits for his family’s upkeep and also in the expansion of his business. Joseph hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase assorted foodstuffs and utensils

loans.name: Rola

texts.en: Rola is a 19-year-old single woman from Marka in Amman, Jordan. She has requested a 700 JOD loan to buy accessories and cosmetics to sell. In the first stage of her business, she only sold accessories; now, she is expanding to sell cosmetics and perfumes. She is looking forward to having her own shop and to improving her family's situation. Since Rola is aged under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy accessories and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en: Emeliana, aged 54, is from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with nine children. Her eldest is 36 and the youngest is 11. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy lead weights, floaters and fishing nets which are needed for fishing activities. Emeliana dreams of being a successful parent by giving her children a good future through education. Her income will be for school fees and for the family's daily consumption. In the future, she hopes to increase business profitability by improving her business.

loans.use: to buy lead weights, floaters and fishing nets

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 57-year-old illiterate woman. She is a widow who is taking care of her children after her husband passed away. Fatmeh has a small clothing sales business with which she is supporting her family. She has applied for this loan to buy a new autumn collection to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a new autumn clothes collection

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat is a 22-year-old single woman from Jubeiha, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 800 JOD to buy clothes to resell in this area. In the future, she would like to expand her business by opening a shop and she hopes to increase her income. Since Ayat is aged under 30, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Riham

texts.en: Riham is a 30-year-old single lady living with her parents. She works in the farming business and has recently started a clothing sales business at home. She has applied for this loan to bring in a new collection of clothes to increase her profits.

loans.use: to bring in a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is from the town of Tiribe; she is a merchant. Janet is a divorced mother to a son. She is a young hardworking, entrepreneurial person who works in order to provide her son everything he needs. Janet has a small retail shop with all the day-to-day necessities that stocks her neighbors and other people who stop in her store. Her goal is to have a larger retail shop in order to continue working and help her family. She is soliciting the loan to purchase bales of wheat, maize flour, breads, and other goods to stock the business; this way she will be able to offer her customers a wider variety.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat, maize flour, breads, and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Jesugo 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUGO 5 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yèyinou est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Yèyinou est âgée de 57 ans et est mariée à un certain Olivier. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et un à leur charge. Yèyinou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Yèyinou n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a une trentaine d’année environs que Yèyinou mène comme activité la vente des céréales (mil, fagots de bois, maïs) à son domicile. Yèyinou s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Yèyinou n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Yèyinou et les autres membres du groupe JESUGO 5 sollicitent ensemble un  troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Jesugo 5 group has three female members, who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Yèyinou, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. This is the third time that this group has requested financial assistance from Alidé, and they have done so to increase their business levels. 

Yèyinou is 57 years of age, and is married to a man named Olivier. The couple has two children, one of whom is at school and one of whom is dependent on them. She lives with her husband and children, and the couple covers the various household expenses. 

Yèyinou did not go to school, and for about 30 years has worked selling cereals (millet, bundles of wood, corn) from home. She gets her supplies in a town in Benin. Customer demand is increasing, and given her limited resources, Yèyinou cannot respond to this demand. As a result, and given their limited means, Yèyinou and the other members of the Jesugo 5 group have requested a third loan from Alidé. Their first two loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy cereals (millet, bundles of wood, corn).

loans.name: Shadai Popol Wuh Group

texts.es:
La señorita Lilia Elena es soltera, tiene 26 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a  la venta de guipiles, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su mamá y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo, que sera utilizado para la compra de hilos de seda, hilo cristal e hilos mish de diferentes colores, espera que en un futuro próximo tener un negocio estable y con un local de venta. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio.
texts.en:
Lilia Elena is single, 26 years of age, and did not have the chance to go to school. She works selling “huipiles” [traditional woven dresses], and started this business thanks to the support of her mother. She has eight years of experience.

Lilia Elena has organized a group to request a loan, which will be used to buy silk thread, crystal thread and mish-style thread of different colors. She hopes to have a stable business with a retail premises in the near future. The group’s other members all work in retail.

loans.use: To buy thread.

loans.name: María Amalia

texts.es:
Maria tiene 33 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos. Ella tiene 8 años de administrar su propia tienda, antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los quehaceres de su casa. Los productos los compra en una ciudad, una vez a la semana. 

Maria  solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar artículos de primera necesidad y aumentar el inventario. Ella manifiesta que necesita comprar en grandes cantidades, a fin de obtener mejores ganancias surtiendo su tienda y atender a más número de clientes; para proporcionar a sus hijos mejores condiciones para vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years of age, divorced, and has two children. She has run her own store for eight years, and before this she only ever worked doing the household chores. She buys her products in a city once a week.

Maria has requested this loan from Fundación Campo, and she plans to use it to buy basic items and increase her inventory. She says that she needs to buy in large quantities, so that she can obtain more income by supplying her store and attracting more customers. This will allow her to provide her children with better conditions and a more dignified life.

loans.use: To buy basic items and increase her inventory.

loans.name: Alogo Jesuston Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOGO JESUSTON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le quartier. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Codjo Philippe est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Codjo Philippe est âgé de 30 ans et est marié à une coiffeuse du nom de Florentine. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. Codjo Philippe n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Codjo Philippe vit ensemble avec ses enfants et sa femme. Codjo Philippe assure ensemble avec sa femme, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Codjo Philippe mène comme activité la vente des tissus et du maïs à son domicile. Codjo Philippe exerce cette activité depuis quatorze ans. Codjo Philippe s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Codjo Philippe sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ALOGO JESUTON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle.
texts.en:
The Alogo Jesuston group has three members, who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Codjo Philippe, and is pictured with his hand raised in the photo. He is 30 years of age, and is married to a hairdresser named Florentine. The couple has six children, some of whom are dependent on them and at school. Codjo Philippe lives with his wife and children, and together the couple covers the different household expenses. To do so, Codjo Philippe works selling fabrics and corn from home, and has done so for 14 years. He gets his supplies in his region and in a town in Benin. 

In order to ensure customer satisfaction and increase his sales and income, Codjo Philippe has requested his first loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Alogo Jesuston group. They will use this loan to increase their product inventories and have a higher number of customers.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and corn.

loans.name: Mahugnon 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON 4 est formé de trois personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine et s’approvisionnant au même endroit. La représentante de ce groupe, Kanon Lydie, celle dont la main est levée sur la photo est âgée de 41 ans. Kanon Lydie est mariée à un certain Waliou et a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Kanon Lydie n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Kanon Lydie vend du riz et de la nourriture à son domicile. Il y a environs vingt ans que Kanon Lydie exerce cette activité. Kanon Lydie s’approvisionne dans sa région. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Kanon Lydie ambitionne agrandir son stock de vente; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Kanon Lydie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON 4, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Mahugnon 4 group is made up of three people who belong to the same "tontine" group (a "tontine" is a revolving finance system whereby each member contributes periodically an agreed amount and this is passed on in rotation to different members) and get their supplies from the same place. The representative of this group, Kanon Lydie, whose hand is raised in the photo, is 41 years old. Kanon Lydie is married to a man called Waliou and has four children, who all attend school and are in the couple's care. Kanon Lydie did not go to school. She sells rice and food from her home and has been doing this for around 20 years. She gets her supplies in her region. Her ambition is to increase her stock so that she can expand her business; this will allow her to respond better to customer demand. To do this, Kanon Lydie is requesting, together with the other members of the Mahugnon 4 group, a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans they have been granted have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy rice and condiments.

loans.name: Blanca Aracely

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 36 años de edad, es viuda y tiene dos hijos. Ella tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de tamales, pan. Lo aprendió por iniciativa propia cuando falleció su esposo. Para comprar los insumos necesarios para elaborar los deliciosos tamales y el pan, aborda un vehiculo hasta un río, luego cruza el río a través de un puente de hamaca; cuando llega al otro lado se traslada en otro vehiculo que la lleva al pueblo más cercano.

Ella solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar materiales que le hacen falta y pago de mano de obra, para construir una galera para su granja de pollos. Con la inversión espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos, para que no les falta nada a su hijos. Ella desea instalar una tienda, establecer bien su granja y que sus hijos tengan acceso a la educación.
texts.en:
Blanca is 36 years of age, widowed, and has two children. She has worked for six years making and selling tamales and bread. She learned this trade on her own initiative, following the death of her husband. To buy the ingredients she needs to prepare delicious tamales and bread, Blanca travels in a vehicle to a river, then crosses the river on a rope bridge, before taking another vehicle on the other side to the closest village.

Blanca has requested a loan from Fundación Campo to buy materials and pay for labor costs required to build a coop for her chicken farm. With this investment she hopes to improve her income, so that her children do not go without anything. She wants to open a store, establish her farm, and ensure that her children have access to education.

loans.use: To buy materials and pay for labor costs required to build a coop for her chicken farm.

loans.name: Saúl Josué

texts.es:
Saúl tiene 22 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Desde hace mucho tiempo él se dedica a trabajar como albañil. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir una pared que le sirva de división en su casa y para comprar teja, madera para el techo de su casa. Lo que más desea es que su familia tenga una casa digna, instalar una granja de pollos y gallinas ponedoras, algo muy importante para él es que su familia siempre este unida.
texts.en:
Saúl is 22 years of age, married, and has one child. He has worked as a bricklayer for a long time now. 

The loan Saúl has requested from Fundación Campo is to build a wall to divide his house, and to buy tiles and wood for the roof of his home. What he wants most is for his family to have a dignified home, and to set up a farm with chickens and laying hens. For Saúl, it is very important that is family remains together.

loans.use: To build a wall to divide his house, and to buy tiles and wood for the roof of his home.

loans.name: Fátima Gisela

texts.es:
Fátima tiene 37 años de edad, es madre de un hijo que estudia sexto grado. Vive con su mamá y su abuelo en casa de ella. Se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos en su casa, desde hace unos 25 años, su mamá vende por la mañana y Fátima por la tarde. El negocio fue iniciado por su mamá, aventurándose a vender poquitas cosas, hoy en día vende alrededor de 200 libras de queso y crema.

Cada semana viaja a una ciudad a comprar la mercadería, luego la almacena en refrigeradoras en su casa para revenderla en su comunidad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 100 libras de queso y 100 libras de crema; que es la mercadería que más vende. Ella necesita mucho realizar la inversión, ya que estuvo enferma y no cuenta con capital para seguir con su negocio y sus clientes siempre le demandan en grandes cantidades.  Ella ha trabajado mucho y lo que desea es instalar una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Fátima is 37 years of age, and is mother to one son who is in the sixth grade. She lives with her mother and grandmother in her grandmother’s house. Fátima works selling dairy products from home, and has done this for 25 years. Her mother sells in the morning, while Fátima sells in the evening. This business was set up by her mother, who started off selling a few things, and nowadays they sell around 200 pounds of cheese and cream.

Each week Fátima travels to a city to buy merchandise, which she then stores in refrigerators in her home and resells the produce to people in the local area. The loan she has requested will be used to buy 100 pounds of cheese and 100 pounds of cream, which are the products that she sells most. She really needs this investment, as she has been ill and does not have the capital she needs to carry on with her business. Her customers always request large quantities of products. Fátima has worked hard, and wants to set up a small store selling basic convenience store items.

loans.use: To buy 100 pounds of cheese and 100 pounds of cream, which are the products that she sells most.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en: Waad is a 19-year-old single lady living with her family; she is the oldest among six siblings. Being a member in a big family and the oldest, has made her  grow up fast. She wants to be a good role model for her siblings, so she passed the high school exams and enrolled herself in the university. She is now studying about radiological imaging and x-rays. She has applied for this loan to pay for her semester fees so she can get the bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Vanic

texts.en: Vanic operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. Besides that, he sells cereals to generate more income. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped him buy maize and beans for resale. This helped his business to improve and with the additional income, he was able to add more stock. Vanic wants to start farming. He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farming activity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Mahuwanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUWANOU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Mahoussi, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Mahoussi est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un boulanger du nom de Thomas. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Mahoussi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près d’une trentaine d’année que Mahoussi exerce comme activité, la vente de nourriture (riz, haricot et pâte) à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Mahoussi s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mahoussi désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Mahoussi sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUWANOU, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Mahuwanou group has three members, who all live in the same neighborhood of Benin and belong to the same savings group. The group’s representative is called Mahoussi, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. This is the second time that this group has requested the financial support of Alidé, and they have done so to increase their business levels. 

Mahoussi is 42 years of age, and is married to a baker called Thomas. The couple has two children, both at school and under their care. The children live with their parents, and the couple makes sure that the various household expenses are met. Mahoussi did not go to school, and for almost 30 years has worked selling food (rice, beans and corn mush) from home. This allows her to easily provide for herself, and she buys her supplies in her region. 

In order to better meet the needs of her customers, Mahoussi wants to consolidate and diversify her business. To do so, she has requested a second loan from Alidé along with the other members of the Mahuwanou group. Their first loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans and corn mash.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en: Valerio is 53 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. He is married with eight children. He is dependent on his sari-sari store business for an income. This supports the needs of his family, especially the food. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, seasoning, and toiletries. This will help his store to be more attractive to his customers. Valerio knows that with an additional capital, it will boost his income too. The profit will provide a nutritious diet for his family. In the future, he hopes to have a bigger store for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, seasoning, and toiletries.

loans.name: Beatrice  Kamene

texts.en: Beatrice is a hardworking 45-year-old business-lady and a mother of five children who are in school. She operates a grocery store in a favorable environment to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for five years. Besides this, she does farming to supplement her income. She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya that helped her to grow her business. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy cabbages, kales, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy cabbages, kales, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread for huipiles

loans.name: Mary  Nzembi

texts.en: Mary is 33 years old and married with three children who are in school. She does photocopying and printing services to earn a living. She has been in this business for seven years and has employed two people. Besides that, she does farming to supplement her income. Mary dreams of operating a computer school in the future. She has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to buy printing papers.

loans.use: To buy printing papers.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Edna. She is married and has 1 child, age 14. She has 1 additional dependent that lives with her.  In 2006, Edna established her enamelware business. She began her business to help promote her husband financially in addressing issues at home. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Edna requires this loan in order to buy 3 dozen sets of pans @ Le1,560,000 and 12 dozen spoons, with the balance to be used for transport. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 800,000. In the future, Edna plans to get a very big shop and to be selling goods at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy 3 dozen sets of pans @ Le1,560,000 and 12 dozen spoons, with the balance to be used for transport.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is 31 years old and makes a living tailoring and selling clothing. He has been in this line of work for the last 8 years. He is a young person with many goals and dreams that he desires to be able to fulfill. Because of these he always makes an effort and tries to get ahead. He is requesting the loan to buy material and thread for tailoring a quantity of clothing that will allow him to have a stock of varied and attractive garments for the public.

loans.use: to buy material and thread for tailoring.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 27 years old and is a grocery store owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married to Titus and together they have three children. She has been running her grocery store for the past three years successfully.

This is Lucy’s first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more green maize, tomatoes and bananas. 

She will use the anticipated profits to open another grocery store and repay her loan. She hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more green maize, tomatoes and bananas for selling.

loans.name: Tillobat

texts.ru: Опытная портниха из Таджикистана нуждается в вашей доброте. Ее зовут Тиллобат и она создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Ей 56  лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет  3 детей. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 15 лет назад она начала свой бизнес. Она работает в ателье в центре города. Ее дочь помогает ей в ведении бизнеса. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Она нуждается новой швейной машинки, но ее доход не позволяет ей купить это. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  10000 сомони для покупки новой швейной машинки и тканей для шитья новых платьев. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en:
An experienced dressmaker from Tajikistan needs your kindness. Her name is Tillobat and the Tajikistani national dresses that she creates are true masterpieces.

Tillobat is 56 years old, divorced, and is raising 3 children. She started her business 15 years ago in order to provide for her family's needs. She works in a sewing studio in the city center. Her daughter helps her in her business. Thanks to the good service Tillobat gives her customers, she has a large clientele. 

Tillobat needs to purchase a new sewing machine but she can't afford to buy one with the income she earns. She is seeking a loan in the amount of 10,000 Tajikistan Somoni in order to buy a sewing machine and fabric to sew new dresses. She hopes that you can assist her.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is a 29-year-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 9 years. He describes himself to be a focused man. He operates a retail store where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are residents from the neighborhood. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes for resale. His business goal is to buy clothes for increasing his business stock over the next 5 years.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with five children. She has been in the cereals business for the last ten years earning approximately KES.10,000 monthly. 

This is Elizabeth’s second loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loan. She borrowed KES.50,000 and plans to use it for purchasing dry maize and beans for resale. 

With the anticipated profits she plans to invest back into her business. She hopes to venture into horticulture.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is a married man who operates a motorcycle taxi. He is taking care of five children, all in school, and has worked in this business for two years. He remarks that his job is very difficult because during the winter he has a lot of obstacles because he has fewer passengers since it's cold. His dream is to buy more motorcycles to work and thus progress every day.

Tsuma is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi, since it is an essential part of his job. He is happy with the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a person with a great sense of responsibility, having established his own grocery store three years ago in his house to provide an income for his family.

James believes the Kiva loans are a good option because getting a bank or financial institution loan is very difficult due to the many documents and guarantees required.

The loan James is requesting is to expand his business so he can better attend to his customers and increase his earnings, thereby offering all of his family a better quality of life since they all depend on him. He plans to use this loan to add stock of wheat flour, rice, sugar, and snacks.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, rice, sugar, and snacks.

loans.name: Omari

texts.en: Omari, 45, is a married man with six children who are all attending school. He works buying and selling goats that are then slaughtered. He buys his goats from different markets in the rural areas and sells them to the slaughterhouses in the city of Mombasa, Kenya. He is applying for the loan to buy a greater number of goats because he had an offer that he wants to take advantage of.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of goats.

loans.name: Tone

texts.en:
Tone is forty-five and has five children, and all of them live in northeast Albania. Two of her children are still attending school. Tone has been helped financially and otherwise from the Area Development Projects of World Vision Albania and she is very grateful for all the help. For the past twenty years Tone has been involved with livestock, raising goats and making delicious goat cheese.

Lately she was also chosen to participate in the value chain project that is a collaboration between World Vision Albania and VisionFund Albania. She wants to buy thirty goats. Based on the business plan that she has been presented with, she can employ others, too, if everything goes as planned.

Tone hopes that lenders at Kiva will help her to achieve her goal by lending to her.

loans.use: To buy thirty goats.

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has had a business of selling clothing for over five years; this is how she supports her household. This enterprising woman wants to make an investment buying clothing to increase her stock of the merchandise she sells. For this Naome has trusted in Yehu, the intermediary institution between Kiva and herself, to get her first loan. With this she plans to get greater profits, because with a greater selection she can attract a larger clientele.

The lack of capital and growth opportunities has been a big obstacle for this woman. Thanks to Kiva and Yehu, Naome not only will have a loan, but she also will be able to get training and advice in such a way that she will have sustainable growth.

loans.use: to buy clothing to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: La Masheñita Paxot Group

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa, esta casada, tiene 31 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo el cual esta estudiando, se dedica ala tejeduría de guipiles y sute, inicio este negocio gracias apoyo de su madre y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien presta sus servicios de jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, para aumentar su producción de guipiles y sutes (suter son sabanas para llenar bebes o puede ser servilletas también cuando son pequeñas), espera mejorar su negocio y sus ingresos. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la tejeduría y al comercio.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a 31 year old married woman who didn't have the chance to go to school. She has 1 son who is in school and works weaving  huipiles and sute [articles of traditional clothing]. She started this business thanks to her mother's support and so far, she has 10 years experience. She has the support of her husband, who is a laborer. 

The group organized the loan to use to buy different colors and types of thread to increase production of huipiles and sutes (sutes are wraps to swaddle babies or they can also be used as napkins when they are small). She hopes to improve her business and her income. The other members work as weavers and merchants.

loans.use: to buy thread to make huipiles and sutes

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El comité San Vicente gracias al trabajo que hacen sus miembros ya está en el segundo ciclo, tienen como meta crecer y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias y también ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Maria es parte de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de sábanas, naranjas y miel de caña de azúcar,  esto gracias al crédito que se le otorgó, nos comenta que mediante el  crédito  pudo mejorar su actividad y su nivel de vida e ingreso económico, es por ello que solicita la ayuda de kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de sabanas y naranjas, para que así pueda seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Thanks to the job of its members, the San Vicente Committee is already working its second cycle. Their goal is to grow professionally in order to support their families as well as to help each other out.
Maria is a member of this group. She engages in selling sheets, oranges and molasses. She says that thanks to the loan she has received she has been able to improve her activity as well as her standard of living and her economic income. For this reason she is asking Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for their support: she will buy sheets and oranges so that she will be able to keep on working and supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy sheets and oranges.

loans.name: Soriba

texts.en:
This is 24 year-old Soriba.  He is single and has no children. In 2007, Soriba established his textiles business. He began his business just after he completed high school. As he did not have the opportunity to pursue his education, he thus went into business. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business.

Soriba would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid his first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy one bail of jeans and to use the remaining amount to pay for transport. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 900,000 SLL.

In the future, Soriba plans to rent a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one bail of jeans for resale and to pay transport costs.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi, 35, is a fish monger in Mombasa. She is the widowed mother of two children, aged seven and ten years. She ventured into this business seven years ago and it is doing great.

She is requesting a second loan from KADET Ltd. Sidi plans to use the loan to purchase more Tilapia, Nile perch fish and sardines to resell to her customers.

The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stock of fish and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more Tilapia, Nile perch fish and sardines.

loans.name: Mahuklo 2 Group

texts.fr: MAHUKLO 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 52 ans et est marié  un maçon du nom de Fulbert. Madeleine est mère de six enfants dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à la charge du couple. Madeleine vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges. Madeleine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près d’une vingtaine d’année que Madeleine mène comme activité la vente du maïs et des charbons de bois à son domicile. Madeleine mène cette activité afin de pouvoir aux besoins du ménage. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Madeleine sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUKLO 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits
texts.en:
Mahuklo 2 is a group of 3 people, whose members all lives in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Madeleine (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 52 years old and married to a builder called Fulbert. Madeleine is the mother of 6 children, some of whom attend school and two of whom are still dependent on the couple. Madeleine lives together with her children and her husband. The couple both take care of the various expenses.

Madeleine did not go to school. She has been selling corn and firewood from her home for nearly 20 years. Madeleine does this so that she is able to meet the household needs. She gets her supplies in her area and in a town in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Madeleine is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of Mahuklo 2. This loan will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Turwanyubujuju Group

texts.fr:
Léa  fait partie du groupe  Turwanyubujuju  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a  52 ans et est mariée à  Déo, un commerçant de bière de banane. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, dont 4   étudient.
Elle prend soin d’un enfant.

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane depuis  25ans. 

Elle est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes pour préparer une grande quantité de bière de banane,  à vendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Léa is part of the Turwanyubujuju group, and lives in Gitega. She is 52 years of age and married to Déo, who sells banana beer. Together they have six children, four of whom are at school. Léa looks after one child, and has worked selling banana beer for 25 years.

This is Léa’s 11th loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan she has applied for, she will increase her capital and buy a lot of bananas, so that she can prepare a large quantity of banana beer to sell and earn more.

loans.use: To increase her capital and buy a lot of bananas, so that she can prepare a large quantity of banana beer to sell and earn more.

loans.name: Luce

texts.en:
Luce is in her early forties and is the mother of five, her oldest child being twenty and youngest being eight. All of her children attend school. As she has a family with five children, she has received financial help from World Vision Albania’s Economic Area Development. “I would not be where I am today without their help. I see progress with my children. They go to school now when they would not otherwise and I’m happy,”” Luce said.

Luce has been selected recently to participate in the Economic Development Program from World Vision Albania and the microfinance of VisionFund Albania to expand her business. She has earned the technical skills and through the project she is now learning the entrepreneurial basic skills that will help her in developing and sustaining her business.

Luce is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy thirty goats and hopes that lenders will show some understanding.

loans.use: to buy thirty goats to expand her business.

loans.name: Oluwatobi 3 Group

texts.fr: OLUWATOBI 3 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Véronique Bibiré (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 61 ans et est mariée à un certain Jérôme. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés dont un reste à leur charge. Véronique Bibiré et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Véronique Bibiré n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de vingt ans que Véronique Bibiré mène comme activité la vente de divers accessoires de sauce (condiments, épices). Véronique Bibiré exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Véronique Bibiré s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Véronique Bibiré sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe OLUWATOBI 3. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Oluwatobi 3 is a group of 3 people, whose members are friends who live in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Véronique Bibiré (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 61 years old and married to Jérôme. The couple have 6 children, all of whom attend, or have attended, school, and one of whom is still dependent on them. Véronique Bibiré and her husband live their child and the couple both take care of the various household responsibilities.

Véronique Bibiré did not go to school. She has been selling various ingredients with which to make sauce (condiments and spices) for nearly 20 years. Véronique Bibiré works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies in her area. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Véronique Bibiré is requesting a 3rd loan, together with the other members of Oluwatobi 3. This loan will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments and spices.

loans.name: Sohoueto 2 Group

texts.fr: SOHOUETO 2 est un groupement de trente cinq personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Sosthène Théophilia (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Thomas. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à leur charge. Sosthène Théophilia et son mari vivent ensemble avec leur enfant et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de leur enfant. Sosthène Théophilia a arrêté l’école au cours primaire.  Il y a cinq ans environs que Sosthène Théophilia exerce comme activité principale, la coiffure dans son atelier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sosthène Théophilia vend des mèches et des produits de cheveux. Sosthène Théophilia exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant. Sosthène Théophilia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Sosthène Théophilia sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Sohoueto 2 is a group of 35 people, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Sosthène Théophilia (pictured with her hand raised in the photo), and she is 36 years of age. She is married to Thomas, and the couple has two children, one at school and under the care of the couple. 

Sosthène Théophilia and her husband live with their child, and together ensure that the child’s various needs are met. Sosthène Théophilia finished her education during elementary school, and now works as a hairdresser in her salon as her main business. In addition, she also sells hair extensions and hair products. She is passionate about this business, and it allows her to provide for herself and her children. 

Sosthène Théophilia buys her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to satisfy her customers, and with the aim of increasing her working capital, she has requested her first loan along with the other members of the Sohoueto 2 group. This loan will allow them to better meet their customers’ requests, as well as to make more profits.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Anila is in the mid forties and married. She is a mother of two and lives in south east Albania. Her primary source of income for the last 6 years has been raising livestock. This activity suits her caring and animal lover personality and is profitable enough to make her a living as well.

Currently, Anila has three cows and has been selling cheese and butter to locals. The cheese she makes in not very salty and not very greasy either, because she takes way the fat before she makes it. Anila has a very steady clientele and many people in the region, who suffer from diabetes, prefer her cheese because it is homemade and low-fat.

Anila would like to add some more cows to her livestock with the loan she is requesting from Kiva. She wants to thank all of the lenders. This is not Anila’s first loan. It’s the fifth one, and all the previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Mahudo Group

texts.fr: MAHUDO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Clautilde (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un marchand du nom de Paul. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, dont certains scolarisés. Clautilde et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges des enfants. Clautilde a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a près de cinq ans que Clautilde mène comme activité la vente des ustensiles de cuisine, du riz et des savons de façon ambulante. Clautilde exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Clautilde s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Clautilde sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUDO. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Mahudo is a group of 3 people, whose members are friends living in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Clautilde (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 24 years old and married to a merchant called Paul. The couple have 3 dependent children, some of whom attend school. Clautilde and her husband live together with their children and the couple both take care of the children's various expenses.

Clautilde left school at secondary level. She has been selling kitchen utensils, rice and soaps on the street for nearly 5 years. Clautilde works intensely, which enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. She gets her supplies in her region. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Clautilde is requesting a first loan, together with the other members of Mahudo. This loan will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Aferdita

texts.en:
Aferdita is in her late forties and is married, with two children, who attend school.  They are Egyptians from the vulnerable ethnic minority of south eastern Albania, and they live in a beautiful little town next to the shore.  Aferdita is very proud of her children attending school, something that is not very usual in her community. 

For the past three years, she has been operating a little business of her own, repairing clothes for residents in her town.  The beginning was very difficult she claims, yet lately, it has picked up and now she wants to employ her niece as well.  People in her town speak very highly of her.

Aferdita is applying for a loan to add one more sewing machine, hoping that she will be helped by Kiva lenders.  In return she promises them that she will pay this loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is fifty one, married and has two children who are presently attending school. They all live in the south of Albania.  Artur has been a sole financial provider for his family of 4, for almost 12 years.  Since they live in the city, there is a scarcity of jobs, which is why his wife hasn’t found any job, even though she is educated.

Feeling financially strapped for some time, Artur decided to open a bar-café three years ago.  An initial loan helped him start this business. Then, he applied for more loans to buy inventory and other necessary items for the cafe.  Kindly note, that he has been very good at paying all the previous loans.

Artur is now applying for another loan to renovate the inside of the bar-cafe.  He hopes that Kiva lenders will show their kindness and lend to him.

loans.use: To renovate the inside of an old bar-cafe

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: MISSIMIDE est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Camillia dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 49 ans. Camillia est mariée à un certain Brice. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble, les différents besoins du ménage. Camillia n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Il y a près de dix huit ans que Camillia mène comme activité la vente des articles de quincaillerie dans son quartier. Camillia exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins. Camillia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Camillia sollicite un troisième crédit avec le second membre du groupe MISSIMIDE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Missimide is a group of 2 people, whose members live in the same area of Benin. The group's representative, Camillia (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 49 years old and married to Brice. The couple have 4 dependent children, some of whom attend school. The couple live with the children and both take care of the various household needs.

Camillia did not go to school. She has been selling hardware items in her district for nearly 18 years. Camillia works with passion, which enables her to meet her needs. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction, Camillia is requesting a 3rd loan, together with the second member of Missimide. This loan will be used by them to better respond to the demands of their clientèle, and to earn more profits. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy hardware items.

loans.name: Girineza Group

texts.fr:
Goreth  fait partie du groupe  Girineza et  habite à Bujumbura. Elle a  31 ans et est mariée à Désiré,un menuisier. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgés de 4 à 8ans.

Elle fait le commerce des habits   depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’habits à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Goreth is part of the Girineza group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 31 years old is married to Désiré, a carpenter. Together, the couple have 3 children, aged between 4 and 8.

Goreth has been selling clothes for 4 years. This will be her second loan from Turame. Her Kiva-sponsored loan will increase her capital and allow her to buy a lot of clothes for resale, so that she can earn more.

loans.use: to buy a lot of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije is 50, married, and has one child who is eighteen years old.  Her husband, who worked in the military for years, was recently laid off and there are no other job openings in his field.

Bukurije has been working as a waitress in a nearby restaurant for the past three years.   At the same time, she has been selling milk and other dairy products to the locals and the restaurant where she works.  She has only one milk cow at the moment and wants to add one more from a good breed to increase the income.

She has no money saved and this is the reason she is requesting a Kiva loan.  Bukurije has repaid two other loans that she had requested in the past.  She hopes that she will receive financial help from the kind Kiva lenders and wants to thank them.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba makes kenkey (sourdough dumplings) to sell. She is showing the soaked corn, which will be washed and milled into dough for the kenkey at Abura. 

Aba uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more corn to prepare kenkey to sell. With the new profits, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more corn to prepare kenkey (sourdough dumplings) to sell

loans.name: Akouegnon 2 Group

texts.fr: AKOUEGNON 2 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Martine Edwige Sènami (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée. Martine Edwige Sènami et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a quelque années que Martine Edwige Sènami exerce comme activité, divers produits et des cartes de recharge dans son quartier. Martine Edwige Sènami exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Martine Edwige Sènami s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement, Martine Edwige Sènami sollicite un premier crédit avec les autres membres du groupe AKOUEGNON 2. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
